audio.title: Metta Retreat 2008 Entire
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: This is a zip file of all the talks given by Ajahn Pasanno during the Metta Retreat he lead in 2008. Note that this file is larger than 200mb and could take a while to download depending on your internet connection. The CD contents are also available for online browsing (opens in new tab) and request as part of the 2014 Winter Retreat DVD Collection.
audio.language: English

audio.title: Curiosity
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the causes of a peaceful mind and what part our curiosity has on in the process of training the mind. This instruction was offered September 17
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Nourishing the Enlightenment Factors
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Luang Por Passano gives a talk centered around the Enlightenment Factors
audio.language: beginning with spiritual friendship as a basis. This instruction was offered September 24

audio.title: Objectification
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Luang Por Pasanno offers his reflections on the sense of \"I am\
audio.language: where it comes from and how to work with it. This instruction was offered September 20

audio.title: Flowing Outward Inwardly
audio.author: Ajahn Saññamo
audio.body: Ajahn Sannamo gives some short reflections on gradually training oneself. This reflection was given on August 22
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Observance Days
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno gives a talk to a Presbyterian group about the practice and benefits of holding a religious Observance Day from a Buddhist perspective. This instruction was offered August 7
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Six Teachers
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno speaks on the theme of the six senses and how the Dhamma can be seen reflecting through our experience of sense contact. This instruction was offered August 21
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Studying the Dhamma and Putting it into Practice
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko offers a variety of reflections on practice such as cultivating positive perceptions and the need for both a \"carrot\" and \"a stick\" to balance ourselves. This reflection was offered on August 6
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Patience and Right Effort
audio.author: Ajahn Saññamo
audio.body: Ajahn Sannamo gives some reflections on different aspects of right effort and the practice of patience. This reflection was given on July 30
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Harmonizing the Faculties
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno gives a talk about the faculties and how they are not just to be strengthened but harmonized with one another. This instruction was offered July 23
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Teen Weekend Talk
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno offers Dhamma reflections during the Teen Weekend at Abhayagiri. This instruction was offered July
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Tudong in California
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: After returning from his walk down to San Diego
audio.language: Ajahn Yatiko recounts some of his experiences and reflections he had on the trip. This reflection was offered on July 16

audio.title: Relying on the Sangha
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno gives some reflections on how our growth in Dhamma can be nourished by our spiritual companions. This instruction was offered June 24
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Parting Advice
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo give some advice and encouragement to two of our monks who are going away to practice in Thailand this year. This reflection was offered on June 25
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Recollections of LP Cha
audio.author: Ajahn Viradhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Viradhammo in a visit to Abhayagiri recounts teachings and experiences living with Ajahn Cha. This reflection was offered on June 16
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Parting Words
audio.author: Ajahn Viradhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Viradhammo\'s parting words to the Abhayagiri Sangha and guests
audio.language: on the theme of how to understand and relate to conventions and to liberation. This reflection was offered on June 22

audio.title: Making the Postures Even
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno offers some reflections about maintaining the practice in all postures. This instruction was offered June 11
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: The Craft of the Heart
audio.author: Ajahn Viradhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Viradhammo gives an analogy of practice like a trade. He offers reflections on how to use the teachings of the Noble Truths to work through difficulties. This reflection was offered on June 18
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Qualities of a Wise Person
audio.author: Ajahn Jayasaro
audio.body: Ajahn Jayasaro gives a detailed commentary on seven qualities a wise person considers. This instruction was offered June 1
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Taking Responsibility For Your Mind
audio.author: Ajahn Jayasaro
audio.body: Ajahn Jayasaro offers a talk covering a wide variety of themes on Buddhist practice during and outside formal meditation practice. This instruction was offered May 28
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Living Together
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno gives a talk about living together
audio.language: and in particular
audio.category: focusing on the monk\'s discipline as a tool for creating harmony within community and also for our own spiritual development. This instruction was offered May 25

audio.title: Faith in the highest
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: From a teaching the Buddha gave
audio.language: Ajahn Yatiko comments on having faith in the Buddha
audio.category: Dhamma and the Sangha and putting that faith into practice. This reflection was offered on May 21

audio.title: Tudong Stories at Spirit Rock part3
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Part 3 of the Spirit Rock daylong. Ajahn Pasanno talks about the gritty reality of practice and shares some stories of monks and their foibles. This instruction was offered May 01
audio.language: 2011 at Spirit Rock.

audio.title: Working through fear and anxiety with the body
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo offers some perspective on working through fear and anxiety by focusing on the body
audio.language: and also developing skillful states of loving kindness
audio.mp3: sympathetic joy and equanimity. This reflection was offered on May 15

audio.title: Vesakha Puja
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno offers some teachings and reflections around holding views
audio.language: and the nature of samsara. This instruction was offered May 17

audio.title: Tudong Stories at Spirit Rock part2
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Part 2 of the Spirit Rock daylong. This is a question and answer session. This instruction was offered May 01
audio.language: 2011 at Spirit Rock.

audio.title: Positive Attitude and Body Contemplation
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko explores the theme of having a positive attitude
audio.language: and then touches upon the benefits of contemplating the body. This reflection was offered on May 10

audio.title: Injunction to Maha Kassapa
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko recounts the story of Maha Kassapa meeting the Buddha and the Buddha\'s instructions to him. This reflection was offered on May 13
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Mothers Day talk
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo reflects upon the qualities of respect
audio.language: humility contentment and gratitude. This reflection was offered on Mother\'s Day

audio.title: Tudong Stories at Spirit Rock
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno talks about Tudong practice and shares stories of peoples experiences practicing them. This instruction was offered May 01
audio.language: 2011 at Spirit Rock.

audio.title: Predominant Influences
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno gives some reflections on how our predominant influences shape our experience. This instruction was offered April 30
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Talk given after novice ordination
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno offers some general advice to the new novice on the occasion of his going forth. This instruction was offered April 26
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Meditation Instructions
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno begins the evening by settling the mind on the breath
audio.language: offering ten minutes of meditation instruction. This instruction was offered April 26

audio.title: The Nature of Becoming
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo gives a talk on how becoming operates in our daily life and gives practical examples identifying them. This reflection was offered on April 23
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Mindful Words
audio.author: Mindful Ways
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno offers a reflection on the practice of mindfulness and in particular skillful speech. This reflection was offered April 16

audio.title: Four Noble Lineages
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.language: after briefly expressing appreciation for Rhoda
audio.mp3: goes on to explore how to skillfully relate to our possessions
audio.user: shelter and mental cultivation. This reflection was offered on April 11

audio.title: Embodying Experience
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno encourages us to set aside our worries
audio.language: our doubts and our fears and simply come back to the basics – awareness of the experience of this breathing body
audio.mp3: right now. This reflection was offered on April 9

audio.title: Revisiting the Eightfold Path
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo revisits the Noble Eightfold Path in terms of daily life and practical application. This reflection was offered on April 4
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Identity View
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno encourages mindfulness of speech in this transition time from retreat back to the normal monastery routine and highlights the importance of investigating Identity View as a basis of practice. This reflection was offered on April 3
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: On Mindfulness
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno offers a fresh exploration of both the importance of mindfulness and how to encourage its cultivation. This reflection was offered on March 19
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: See How Peacful You Can Become
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno explores the five hindrances and the five factors of Jhana in the context of encouraging the resident community to make the most of the remaining time of the Winter Retreat. This reflection was offered on March 12
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: When Things Don’t Work Out
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo offers reflections on how to work with difficult periods in one’s practice
audio.language: when it seems the path is not necessarily leading anywhere. This reflection was offered on March 5

audio.title: Exploring the Five Aggregates
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the five Khandhas: From
audio.language: Feeling
audio.user: and the stress they cause us when wrongly grasped. This reflection was offered March 4

audio.title: The Need to Question
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno explores the importance of questioning ourselves as a source of both encouragement and reflection. This reflection was offered February 26
audio.language: 2011 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Walking in India
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko recollects the adventures of his recent trip to the land of the Buddha
audio.language: emphasizing how he used the experiences there as opportunities to learn how to roll with the punches
audio.category: adapt to adversity and rise to challenges. This reflection was offered on February 19

audio.title: The Teachings of All Awakened Ones
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno expounds on the foundations of the way leading to freedom
audio.language: as laid down in brief verses by the Buddha on “Magha Puja”. This reflection was offered on “Magha Puja”

audio.title: The Buddhas Toolbox
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo encourages us to make the most of our rare and precious opportunity for practicing the Dhamma with the supporting conditions surrounding us. He emphasizes the skillful assessment of our current Mind state
audio.language: and the application of the appropriate method or reflection to bring us back on course. This reflection was offered on February 12

audio.title: Dispassion and Relinquishment
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno explores how we can move forward along the path towards the peace of dispassion and relinquishment
audio.language: using skillful reflections on impermanence
audio.category: unsatisfactoriness and not-self. This reflection was offered February 11

audio.title: Mindfulness of Breathing
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno provides a fresh perspective on the framework for practicing mindfulness of breathing
audio.language: using the Buddha’s advice. This reflection was offered February 5

audio.title: Old Seeds New Possibilities
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on noticing the difference between “old Kamma”
audio.language: created from birth and cultivated for years
audio.category: which should be dealt with patience and acceptance
audio.status: which provides an opportunity for shaping the present and future
audio.user: and should be dealt with active effort. This reflection was offered February 3

audio.title: Reflections on Ajahn Maha Boowa passing Away
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: After receiving the announcement of Ajahn Maha Boowa’s death
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno speaks with appreciation on the life and teachings of this legendary meditation master of the Thai forest tradition. This reflection was offered January 29

audio.title: The Joy of Seclusion
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno explores the five benefits of solitude
audio.language: both of body and mind
audio.category: expounded by the Buddha and the venerable Sariputta. This reflection was offered January 27

audio.title: Reflections on Aspiration
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno encourages us to form clear aspirations and explores the five supports the Buddha pointed out for fulfilling them: Confidence or faith
audio.language: virtue
audio.status: and wisdom. This reflection was offered January 22

audio.title: Be Like the Earth
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo offers guidance on how to receive and work with criticism
audio.language: both from others
audio.category: as well as from within. This reflection was offered on January 15

audio.title: Coming to Our Senses
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo contemplates the six sense bases – mind
audio.language: eye
audio.youtube_id: and how we get burned throughout the day by the minds movement towards desire or aversion. This reflection was offered on January 12

audio.title: Encouraging the Enlightenment Factors
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno Illustrates how we can encourage the seven factors that support awakening: Mindfulness
audio.language: Investigation of Dhamma
audio.user: concentration and equanimity. This reflection was offered January 8

audio.title: Not Nourishing the Hindrances
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.language: in the first Dhamma Talk of the 2011 Monastic Retreat
audio.category: explains the ways we either feed or starve the hindrances both during formal meditation
audio.mp3: as well as throughout the day .This reflection was offered January 4

audio.title: Skillful Faith
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: In the first Abhayagiri Dhamma Talk of the New Year
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on faith
audio.category: in light of his latest visit to Thailand and also in relation to Ajahn Chah and the beginning of the winter retreat for Abhayagiri resident community. This reflection was offered January 1

audio.title: Going for Refuge
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko reflects on the value and meaning of taking refuge in the triple gem. This reflection was offered December 29
audio.language: 2010 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: On Compassion
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo reflects on the theme of compassion
audio.language: recollecting the value placed on it in both Buddhist and Christian traditions. This reflection was offered on Christmas Eve

audio.title: Simplicity and Transcendence
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo reflects on the theme of developing simplicity and renunciation as an important part of the path for attaining transcendence. This reflection was offered December 18
audio.language: 2010 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Advice for our Journey
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: In this collection of contemplations
audio.language: Ajahn Yatiko touches upon various themes including the value of simplicity
audio.category: cultivating faith in the Buddha and the value of relinquishing our attachment to the body. This reflection was offered December 11

audio.title: Putting Down the Burden
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the five Khandhas as a burden
audio.language: exploring how we can put those down. He discusses the chant regarding that burden and mentions his own feeling “under the weather” in the last week or two. This reflection was offered November 14

audio.title: Skillful Speech
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno expounds on the criteria for speech laid down by the Buddha
audio.language: as in the Sutta describing the simile of the saw. He explores the criteria both in how we receive speech and in how we use it. This reflection was offered November 13

audio.title: Stilling the Water
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on meditation practice and the qualities of mind using the image of still water. He encourages letting the mind settle down rather then forcing it into stillness. This teaching was offered October 2
audio.language: 2010 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Feeling our Way
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo explores skillfully working with feeling tone as part of our spiritual practice. This reflection was offered December 4
audio.language: 2010 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Inhabiting the Body
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno elucidates the importance of skillfully using the body as part of one’s spiritual path. This reflection was offered November 6
audio.language: 2010 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Six Unsurpassed Things
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Unsurpassed seeing
audio.language: hearing
audio.status: training and recollection - Ajahn Yatiko delves into this inspirational list presented by the Buddha. This reflection was offered October 31

audio.title: The Buddha\'s Antidotes
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Contemplating the body
audio.language: loving-kindness
audio.category: impermanence and mindfulness of breathing - Ajahn Pasanno explores the various remedies that the Buddha offers us for the ailments of our mind. This teaching was offered October 8

audio.title: The Eight Qualities of Training
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno contemplates eight qualities the Buddha outlined as guidelines for training the mind. These eight characteristics of the training were spoken by the Buddha while he was giving advice to his step mother. This teaching was offered October 1
audio.language: 2010 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: The Four Distortions
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Permanence
audio.language: lasting satisfaction
audio.category: self and attractiveness : Ajahn Yatiko explores four ways in which the mind causes us problems by distorting our perceptions. This teaching was offered October 16

audio.title: The Way of the Pilgrim
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo contemplates the theme of pilgrimage in relation to our own spiritual quest. This teaching was offered September 25
audio.language: 2010 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Ajahn Chah and the Middle Way
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno contemplates the different areas of balance while on the spiritual path while bringing to mind recollections of his teacher
audio.language: Ajahn Chah. This teaching was offered September 23

audio.title: Recollections of Ajahn Chah - His Life and Teachings - Part 3
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: During this daylong retreat
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno shares teachings and memories of his beloved teacher
audio.category: Ajahn Chah. By the time of his passing in 1992
audio.mp3: Ajahn Chah had become one of the most highly revered Buddhist meditation masters in Thailand. These teachings were offered at Spirit Rock Meditation Center on September 19

audio.title: The Practice of Chanting
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno explains the history
audio.language: tradition
audio.category: and practice of chanting. The many benefits include calm
audio.youtube_id: mindfulness and harmony. This talk was given on September 4

audio.title: Ajahn Chah\'s Teachings of Nature
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno recounts stories of Ajahn Chah’s teachings during the time he lived with him. Whether it was a simile of the trees
audio.language: leaves
audio.mp3: Ajahn Chah knew how to explain profound concepts in simple terms. This talk was given September 18

audio.title: Recollections of Ajahn Chah - His Life and Teachings - Part 1
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: During this daylong retreat
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno shares teachings and memories of his beloved teacher
audio.category: Ajahn Chah. By the time of his passing in 1992
audio.mp3: Ajahn Chah had become one of the most highly revered Buddhist meditation masters in Thailand. These teachings were offered at Spirit Rock Meditation Center on September 19

audio.title: Reflections for Healing
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno speaks on the advice the Buddha gave to a sick monk. These subjects for reflection such as: the unattractive nature of the body
audio.language: the repulsiveness of food
audio.mp3: impermanence and death are important tools for everyone to practice with. This was recorded on September 2

audio.title: Instruction After Ordination
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno offers guidance to newly ordained novice Suddhaso and postulant Joe. This reflection was offered August 18
audio.language: 2010 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Exploring the Spiritual Path Kindness and Virtue
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno speaks to the Spirit Rock Teen Group staying at Abhayagiri about his life story; his interest in becoming a Buddhist since his youth on until he met Ajahn Chah in Thailand. He gives encouragement to investigate
audio.language: practice kindness and virtue while seeking support from monasteries
audio.mp3: and meditation centers. This talk was offered August 28

audio.title: Family of Truth
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Shortly after returning from the Spirit Rock Family Retreat
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno contemplates taking the four noble truths to heart. This reflection was offered August 10

audio.title: Seeing Difficulty
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno contemplates treading the Middle Way between self-torture and sensual indulgence. This talk was given at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on August 14

audio.title: Structures for Freedom
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko explores how we can use structures to support our spiritual aspirations. In particular
audio.language: he also touches on the issues of despair
audio.category: kamma and the seven enlightenment factors. This reflection was offered August 7

audio.title: Measuring the Mind
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: At the beginning of Vassa 2010
audio.language: Ajahn Pasano advises the Abhayagiri community to focus on formal meditation practice. He urges us to “measure the mind
audio.category: ” not in the sense of fretting about whether meditation is going well or poorly but rather to discern the tendencies and needs of the mind and then to investigate methods to balance unskillful tendencies such as restlessness or dullness. Given on July 31

audio.title: Winds of Change - Question and Answer
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: \"For the Love of the World\" is Ajahn Amaro\'s final series of teachings before his departure for England. In this series Ajahn Amaro explores the themes of the elements and the natural ecological concerns that arise when we love the world. How can we bring our understanding of the earth directly into the practice? How can we support our work in the world with the gems of meditation? What did the Buddha have to say about the environment and our relationship to nature? These events took place during June 2010 at Yoga Mendocino in Ukiah
audio.language:
CA. 

June 9 - "Feeling the Earth Move" 
June 16 - "Still and Flowing
audio.category:
Wild Water" 
June 23 - "All is Burning" 
June 30 - "Winds of Change"

audio.title: Not A Complex Thing
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro reminds us how to keep spiritual life simple while
audio.language: exploring helpful ways to relate to the fundamentals of traditional Buddhist practice: the three refuges and the basic precepts. This dhamma offering was made on June 26

audio.title: Bhikkhu Utility Tent
audio.author: Ajahn Chandako
audio.body: In this light hearted talk
audio.language: Ajahn Chandako
audio.category: uses the opening of the new Bhikkhu Commons
audio.status: ” to delve into various aspects of living a simple
audio.user: meaningful life. Ajahn Chandako is abbot of Vimutti Monastery in New Zealand. He offered this Dhamma Reflection on July 3

audio.title: An Urgent Matter
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko explores the roots of our motivation for practice. He also offers us a few useful reflections to help us remember the opportunities we have. This dhamma reflection occurred on June 12
audio.language: 2010 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: The Relish of Becoming
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro describes bhavatanha as “the relish of becoming
audio.language: ” the pleasure that results from ascribing reality to our thoughts about a future self or world. He relates bhavatanha to self-identity view and clinging to conventions (two of the first three fetters that bind us to samsara) and contrasts it with the four aspects of right effort. Ajahn Amaro concludes by quoting three aphorisms from the late Barry Kapke that illustrate the nature of selfless effort. Given on June 19

audio.title: Where are you?
audio.author: Ajahn Sucitto
audio.body: Ajahn Sucitto
audio.language: abbot of Cittaviveka Monastery
audio.mp3: touching on such themes as faith and urgency and how to approach the daunting virtues of patience
audio.status: sense restraint and renunciation. This reflection was offered on June 5

audio.title: The Greatest Fear
audio.author: Bhante Seelananda
audio.body: Bhante Seelananda
audio.language: who ordained in Sri Lanka in 1984
audio.category: offers a Dhamma reflection explaining a dialogue between a brahmin and the Buddha. The explanation is preceded by an introduction by Ajahn Yatiko and a short chant by Bhante Seelananda. Bhante Seelananda is the abbot of the Samatha Vipassana Meditation Centre in Edmonton
audio.status: which was founded under his guidance in 2006. This offering was made June 11

audio.title: What is Truly Miraculous?
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro contemplates the stories of the Buddha’s birth
audio.language: awakening and passing away on the occasion of the Full Moon of May
audio.category: Visakha Puja. This talk was given May 28

audio.title: Even the Buddha...
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the Buddha and keeping our balance amidst the various forces that tug at our mind. This talk was given May 29
audio.language: 2010 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Yoniso Manasikara - Attention Grounded in Dhamma
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno explains that it is essential to establish yoniso manisikara (wise or appropriate attention) in order for our meditation practice to bear fruit. The focus and scope of our attention needs to be deliberate and purposeful
audio.language: and we should avoid objects of attention that foster negativity towards ourselves or external circumstances. Given on May 8

audio.title: One Word for the Buddha
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: What comes to mind when we think of the Buddha? Ajahn Pasanno explores faith and our ideas of the Buddha. This talk was given May 22
audio.language: 2010 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Dangerous Nutrition
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: In this hard-hitting talk
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno uses the theme of nutriment to remind us of the danger of blindly believing in and depending on our craving for sense pleasure and personal identity. He begins with the first of the Novice’s Questions [Khuddhakapatha 4]: “What is one? – All beings subsist on nutriment
audio.category: ” and then explains the simile of parents surviving on the flesh of their child from Samyutta Nikaya 12.63. Given on May 6

audio.title: A Time to Step Back
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the usefulness of regularly setting aside time to review our lives and our priorities. This talk was given May 21
audio.language: 2010 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Falling Into Delusion
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo explores how we can use mindfulness and perception to disentangle the tangles of our mind.
audio.language: English

audio.title: Keeping Things Simple
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno brings us back to the basic principles of meditation.
audio.language: English

audio.title: Be Aware
audio.author: Let Go
audio.language: Continuing the theme of calm and insight
audio.category: Ajahn Pasanno explains the first and fourth tetrads of the Anapanasati Sutta (Mindfulness of in-and-out breathing). He emphasizes the opportunity and necessity to enjoy meditation and the importance of investigating the qualities of impermanence
audio.status: cessation and relinquishment (the fourth tetrad). Given on May 1

audio.title: Non-Contention - Part 7 - Final Q & A
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Criticism
audio.language: sense of self and ultimate reality: Ajahn Amaro responds to questions on these topics during the final part of the Daylong Program “I’m Right
audio.category: You’re Wrong!”: Attachment to Views and the Buddha’s Path of Non-Contention
audio.mp3: which occurred at Spirit Rock on Saturday

audio.title: The Gift of Virtue
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro reflects on the five precepts and explores why the Buddha called them the five great gifts.
audio.language: English

audio.title: Non-Contention - Part 6 - Talk 3
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Is there one single right thing we should do? “No
audio.language: ” says Ajahn Amaro. Rather
audio.category: it is more skillful to view the process of making choices in life as an exploration in attunement. This final reflection was offered during the Daylong Program “I’m Right
audio.mp3: You’re Wrong!”: Attachment to Views and the Buddha’s Path of Non-Contention
audio.status: at Spirit Rock Meditation Center on Saturday

audio.title: Non-Contention - Part 5 - Guided Meditation 2
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro assists us in cultivating spaciousness around the difficult encounters in our lives by deliberately bringing them to mind while seated in formal meditation. This guided meditation was offered during the Daylong Program “I’m Right
audio.language: You’re Wrong!”: Attachment to Views and the Buddha’s Path of Non-Contention
audio.category: at Spirit Rock Meditation Center on Saturday

audio.title: Non-Contention - Part 4 - Talk 2
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Making judgments and taking sides: Ajahn Amaro explores how to skillfully work with these behaviors. This reflection was offered during the Daylong Program “I’m Right
audio.language: You’re Wrong!”: Attachment to Views and the Buddha’s Path of Non-Contention
audio.category: which occurred at Spirit Rock Meditation Center on Saturday

audio.title: Non-Contention - Part 3 - Q & A 1
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Do fully enlightened beings get angry? Ajahn Amaro responds to questions about working with difficult emotions. These reflections were offered during the Daylong Program “I’m Right
audio.language: You’re Wrong!”: Attachment to Views and the Buddha’s Path of Non-Contention
audio.category: which occurred at Spirit Rock on Saturday

audio.title: Me and MY Problems
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno contemplates cultivating right view
audio.language: which entails viewing experience in terms of the Four Noble Truths rather than the standpoint of “me and my problems.”

audio.title: Non-Contention - Part 2 - Guided Meditation
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro guides us through contemplating conflict. This guided meditation was offered during the Daylong Program “I’m Right
audio.language: You’re Wrong!”: Attachment to Views and the Buddha’s Path of Non-Contention
audio.category: which occurred at Spirit Rock on Saturday

audio.title: Sometimes Sun
audio.author: Sometimes Rain
audio.language: Ajahn Amaro reflects on maintaining balance amidst the inevitable ups and downs in life: praise and blame
audio.status: and happiness and unhappiness. These four pairs laid out by the Buddha are commonly referred to as the worldly winds.

audio.title: Non-Contention - Part 1 - Opening Talk
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro explores the difference between being right in fact and right in Dhamma in the opening talk. This reflection was offered during the Daylong Program “I’m Right
audio.language: You’re Wrong!”: Attachment to Views and the Buddha’s Path of Non-Contention at Spirit Rock Meditation Center on Saturday

audio.title: It\'s Just Nature: The Four Elements
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno investigates how we can view our life using the Four Elements rather than our usual perception of self-view.
audio.language: English

audio.title: Communal Harmony
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Generosity
audio.language: kindly speech
audio.category: acts of service and impartiality: Ajahn Pasanno explores these four conditions leading to communal harmony.

audio.title: A Noble Framework
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno explores viewing both meditation and daily life using the Four Noble Truths. This previously unreleased talk examines how the Four Noble truths are an easily overlooked and underestimated tool that we can use to skillfully view our experience.
audio.language: English

audio.title: A Generous Time
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro speaks on the giving of time and attention as an act of generosity and as a practicing of selflessness and letting go..
audio.language: English

audio.title: Faith and Five Faculties
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro reflects on skillfully working with our tendencies from the perspective of the Five Faculties: faith
audio.language: energy

audio.title: The Lens of Dhamma
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno explores how we can skillfully shift our habitual perspectives from the worldly to Dhammmic ones. Lokādhipateyyaṁ
audio.language: attādhipateyyaṁ

audio.title: Five Bases for Liberation
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno expands our idea of the path to awakening by exploring other means of reaching liberation besides traditional meditation.
audio.language: English

audio.title: No Other Refuge
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro reflects on the significance of the triple refuge which forms the heart of the Buddhist path -- Buddha
audio.language: Dhamma

audio.title: The Odor of Self
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the theme on not-self
audio.language: encouraging us to investigate how the self arises.

audio.title: Divine Abodes
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko reflects on exalted qualities of mind
audio.language: the four brahmaviharas
audio.category: which lead to harmony both within oneself and with others.

audio.title: O.B.E...F.Y.I.
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro reflects on his recent decision to accept the abbotship of Amaravati Monastery in line with the theme of not-self
audio.language: anatta.

audio.title: The Spirit of Giving
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: On Christmas Eve Ajahn Yatiko reflects on the theme of generosity.
audio.language: English

audio.title: Beginning Anew
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: On New Year\'s Eve Ajahn Karunadhammo shares reflections on forgiveness
audio.language: reconciliation and moving forward.

audio.title: Relationships
audio.author: Stillness and the Path
audio.language: Ajahn Yatiko reflects on a variety of themes including relating to elders and cultivating contentment.

audio.title: Understanding Our Heart and Mind
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko explores how we can skillfully relate to religious symbols
audio.language: protocols and the phases of our own heart and mind.

audio.title: Dhamma Reflection within the Still Mind
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: On the sixth day of the 2009 Thanksgiving Retreat
audio.language: Ajahn Amaro answers the question: When my mind is still

audio.title: The Brahmaviharas: Bringing the Heart into the Present
audio.author: Ajahn Metta
audio.body: On the fifth day of the 2009 Thanksgiving Retreat
audio.language: Ajahn Metta speaks about the importance of bringing a quality of heart into our practice and tells a memorable story about a dog barking at its own echo.

audio.title: Tracing Proliferation Back to Sense Contact
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: On the third day of the 2009 Thanksgiving Retreat
audio.language: Ajahn Amaro describes the process of \"Tracing back the radiance\" - tracking a stream of mental proliferation back to its origin in simple sense contact.

audio.title: Proliferation or Harmony
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the dangers of getting hooked by the mind\'s tendency toward proliferation and the importance of inner and outer harmony.
audio.language: English

audio.title: A Spark in the Hay Barn
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro reflects on dealing with dispute and the importance of communal harmony.
audio.language: English

audio.title: Cultivating Gratitude
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the cultivation of gratitude as a skillful means of dealing with difficult mind states and experiences.
audio.language: English

audio.title: Breath and the White Lotus
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro offers a reflection on the anniversary of the full moon night when the Buddha offered the Anapanasati Sutta
audio.language: a teaching on mindfulness of breathing.

audio.title: Gratitude To Our Guides
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro reflects on cultivating thankful appreciation for our parents and teachers.
audio.language: English

audio.title: Spiritual Balance
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: What does it mean to have a spiritual life? Ajahn Amaro explores how we can approach our spiritual practice in a skillful and harmonious manner
audio.language: while also reflecting on the concepts of spirituality and mindfulness.

audio.title: The Gradual Path
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo reflects on working with the discouraging times of practice
audio.language: the plateaus where we doubt whether we are making progress. Furthermore
audio.category: Ajahn Karunadhammo elucidates the gradual nature of the path to awakening.

audio.title: The Highest Gift
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: On the occasion of Kathina
audio.language: the largest annual gathering at Abhayagiri
audio.category: Ajahn Amaro reflects on the spirit of generosity and the brightness of the heart that accompanies the various types of selfless action. Kathina is the annual festival day and ceremony which takes place during the month after the three-month rains retreat season (the monsoon season in Southeast Asia) for the monastic order.

audio.title: Giving Up Our Grudges
audio.author: Ajahn Sona
audio.body: Ajahn Sona discusses the five ways the Buddha recommends for getting beyond our persistent feelings of hostility and ill will towards others. Ajahn Sona
audio.language: the abbot of Birken Forest Monastery in British Columbia
audio.mp3: offered this reflection while visiting Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Who is dying?
audio.author: Ajahn Sona
audio.body: Ajahn Sona reflects on what it means to be \"dying\" and what significance that has for the living. Ajahn Sona
audio.language: the abbot of Birken Forest Monastery in British Columbia
audio.mp3: offered this reflection during a visit to Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Seasons of Mist - Part 4
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro explores how we can free our heart from fearful and ego-fixated attitudes concerning ageing and illness in part 4 of 4 of the daylong retreat at Spirit Rock Meditation Center on September 27

audio.title: Seeing the Stories
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Our fears
audio.language: our habits
audio.mp3: are these who and what we truly are? Ajahn Amaro reflects on how we can skillfully relate to our situation and our stories.

audio.title: Seasons of Mist - Part 3
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro explores how we can free our heart from fearful and ego-fixated attitudes concerning ageing and illness in part 3 of 4 of the daylong retreat at Spirit Rock Meditation Center on September 27

audio.title: Seasons of Mist - Part 2
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro explores how we can free our heart from fearful and ego-fixated attitudes concerning ageing and illness in part 2 of 4 of the daylong retreat at Spirit Rock Meditation Center on September 27

audio.title: Seasons of Mist - Part 1
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro explores how we can free our heart from fearful and ego-fixated attitudes concerning ageing and illness in part 1 of 4 of the daylong retreat at Spirit Rock Meditation Center on September 27

audio.title: An Attitude of Attunement
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro encourages us to focus on the attitude with which we make our choices in life rather than merely the content of the choices themselves.
audio.language: English

audio.title: Not Clinging
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro offers reflections on the paradox between attentiveness and not clinging
audio.language: during a teaching visit to the Tassajara Zen Mountain Center.

audio.title: The Autumn of Life
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: How can we skillfully relate to ageing
audio.language: illness and mortality? Ajahn Amaro mulls over this theme
audio.category: exploring how we can wisely work with these often shunned parts of our life. \n\n

audio.title: Cooling Down
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro reflects on the word \"nibbana
audio.language: \" which signifies the complete cooling of the mind from the greed
audio.category: hatred and delusion that give rise to stress and agitation.

audio.title: Our Slow Little Brother
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on skillful ways to relate to our mind. In particular
audio.language: he encourages us to see how the mind makes suffering for itself and to work with our persistent unskillful mental habits as if relating to a younger brother who doesn\'t quite have it together.

audio.title: Limits and Letting Go
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro reflects on the themes of voluntary boundaries and letting go. This reflection was offered on September 19
audio.language: 2009 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery. \n\n

audio.title: The Bases for Success
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Whether we want to become a great chess player or reach our noble spiritual aspirations
audio.language: Ajahn Amaro reflects on four qualities that the Buddha points to as providing the foundations for success.

audio.title: The Essence of Kamma
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno explores kamma
audio.language: the Buddha\'s teaching that our actions do indeed have consequences. Furthermore
audio.category: the path beyond suffering lies in understanding which actions lead to stress and which lead to well-being.

audio.title: Tranquility and Insight
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Drawing inspiration from an ancient Buddhist teaching
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on how we can use tranquility and insight in a complementary manner in our meditation practice.

audio.title: What\'s this equanimity thing?
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: How can we be steady like the earth even during tumultuous times? Ajahn Amaro fleshes out the often overlooked quality of equanimity in this dhamma reflection offered on August 14th
audio.language: 2009 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: The Foundations of Delusion
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno contemplates the workings of the five types of hindrances within our mind and how they impede us from seeing clearly.
audio.language: English

audio.title: My Enlightenment Program
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro illustrates how we weigh ourselves down by getting lost in our lives and our problems and how we can lighten our load. This reflection was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on Saturday night
audio.language: August 22

audio.title: Good Enough
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno explores how we tangle ourselves up in desire
audio.language: aversion and discontent and reflects on the way out.

audio.title: Nurturing the Core of Knowing
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the value of being \"the one who knows\" in both meditation and daily activity.
audio.language: English

audio.title: Lunar Reflection
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno contemplates the origins of the uposotha
audio.language: the weekly lunar observance day
audio.category: as well as various frameworks the Buddha offered us for reflection including the the seven factors of enlightenment.

audio.title: Inspiring Encounters with Ajahn Pasanno
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro shares his impressions of Ajahn Pasanno as a junior monk in Thailand and describes the beginning of their collaboration to found Abhayagiri Monastery. Given July 25
audio.language: 2009 on the eve of Ajahn Pasanno\'s 60th birthday.

audio.title: Not a Belief System
audio.author: Ajahn Jayasaro
audio.body: Ajahn Jayasaro offers reflections on his view of Buddhism as an education system rather than a belief system
audio.language: during the June 21st Upasika Day at Abhayagiri. The Upasika days are a chance for the broader lay community to come to the monastery and reflect on a particular theme

audio.title: Back to the Basics
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: After a busy spring
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno offers the community a \"tune-up\" on the basics of meditation.

audio.title: Genuine Attunement
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Can we be too perfect? Ajahn Amaro reflects on how we can skillfully apply energy with a wise and balanced quality of a heart.
audio.language: English

audio.title: The Art of Letting Go - Part 4 - Q & A
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro offers final reflections on letting go
audio.language: seeing things clearly and attuning to the stress in our lives during the last Question & Answer session of the Art of Letting Go series. The series explores the Four Noble Truths
audio.category: the Buddha\'s basic advice for working with stress
audio.mp3: dis-ease and dissatisfaction in our lives.

audio.title: The Art of Letting Go - Part 4 - Meditation
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro offers a twenty-five minute guided meditation during Part 4 of the Art of Letting Go series. The series explores the Four Noble Truths
audio.language: the Buddha\'s basic guidance for the way to understand and transcend the stress
audio.category: dissatisfaction and dis-ease in our lives.

audio.title: The Art of Letting Go - Part 4
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro reflects on how we can stop struggling with the stress
audio.language: dissatisfaction and unease in our lives in the final segment of the Art of Letting Go series.

audio.title: The Art of Letting Go - Part 3 - Q & A
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro reflects on working with pain and our various internal voices in a Question and Answer session during Part 3 of the Art of Letting Go series. The series explores the Four Noble Truths
audio.language: the Buddha\'s basic advice for working with stress
audio.category: pain and dissatisfaction in our lives. .

audio.title: The Art of Letting Go - Part 3 - Meditation
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro offers a twenty-five minute guided meditation during Part 3 of the Art of Letting Go series. The series explores the Four Noble Truths
audio.language: the Buddha\'s basic advice for working with stress
audio.category: pain and dissatisfaction in our lives. .

audio.title: Everyone Benefits
audio.author: Nobody Loses Out
audio.language: During his stay at Abhayagiri
audio.category: Ajahn Liem wrote a reflection on spiritual gratitude. This smooth
audio.mp3: elegant and concise translation was read out to those gathered at Abhayagiri on the final evening of Ajahn Liem\'s stay.

audio.title: The Art of Letting Go - Part 2 - Meditation
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro offers a twenty-five minute guided meditation during the second part of the Art of Letting Go series. This segment explores the question: What is the cause of the dissonance and dissatisfaction in our lives?
audio.language: English

audio.title: The Art of Letting Go - Part 2 - Q & A
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: How do we cultivate a change of heart so that we can live at ease? Ajahn Amaro touches on this theme during the Question and Answer Session for Part 2 of the Art of Letting Go series.
audio.language: English

audio.title: The Art of Letting Go - Part 1 - Q & A
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: How do we accept ourselves and yet still change? This is just one of the questions Ajahn Amaro reflects on during the first Question & Answer session of the Art of Letting Go series.
audio.language: English

audio.title: The Art of Letting Go - Part 3
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: A life without struggle is indeed possible: Ajahn Amaro explores the good news of the Buddha\'s guidance on working with difficulty in our lives in the third talk of a four part series on the Four Noble Truths
audio.language: the Buddha\'s basic guidance for living skillfully.

audio.title: The Art of Letting Go - Part 2
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: What is the cause of dissonance? Ajahn Amaro reflects on the feeling that things are not quite right with the universe in the second talk of the four part series on the Buddha\'s guidance for working with the difficult aspects of our lives
audio.language: also known as the Four Noble Truths.

audio.title: The Art of Letting Go - Part 1
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Stress
audio.language: unsatisfactoriness
audio.category: suffering - Ajahn Amaro explores in easy to understand language the less than lovely part of our experience in this brief first talk
audio.mp3: which is the opening reflection of a four part series on the Buddha\'s guidance on how we can work with the difficulties in our lives
audio.status: commonly referred to as the Four Noble Truths.

audio.title: Reflections on the Eight Precepts
audio.author: Ajahn Jayasaro
audio.body: Ajahn Jayasaro describes the meaning and significance of the Eight Precepts undertaken by lay Buddhists on lunar observance days. He tells the story of a tribe of monkeys who (unsucessfully) refrain from eating bananas in the evening. Given June 15

audio.title: Flavor of the World
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: In this talk ending the 2006 winter retreat
audio.language: Ajahn Amaro talks about the bittersweet nature of the world
audio.category: where freshness turns to decay and pleasure is inextricably mixed with pain. How does this compare to that which is beyond the conditioned world?

audio.author: Ajahn Amaro

audio.language: teaching the practice of contentment was seen as one of the best ways to introduce the teachings of Ajahn Chah.

audio.title: It\'s More Delicious if You Share
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: All of us strive for happiness
audio.language: but it so often escapes our grasp. Ajahn Amaro reflects on how generosity creates the causes for happiness.

audio.language: given by Ajahn Amaro on April 1st

audio.status: Ajahn offers reflections on how we can use mindfulness to both notice and let go of suffering.

audio.language: 2005. He reflects on how we often find ourselves bound

audio.language: 2005 talk was offered by Ajahn Pasanno at Abhayagiri and reflects on ways of using meditation to become more familiar with how we experinece mind-consciousness.

audio.language: 2005) of the 10-day Thanksgiving Retreat
audio.mp3: held at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa
audio.status: California. Ajahn Amaro draws upon one of his favorite suttas to offer reflections on how we can choose to either create or avoid suffering.

audio.title: The Well of the Buddha\'s Teachings
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno

audio.category: Ajahn Pasanno offers his last Dhamma talk before setting off on his planned 15-month sabbatical in Asia.

audio.body: This talk was given on Saturday
audio.language: November 19
audio.category: 2005 at Abhayagiri. Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the theme of \'letting go\' and how we need to cultivate this quality within the mind.

audio.body: This talk by Ajahn Amaro was given at the regular Saturday night gathering at Abhayagiri on December 17th
audio.language: 2005. Ajahn touches on themes such as loving-kindness and compassion to explore how we can love without grasping.

audio.title: Faith in What and How?
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: If faith is a good thing
audio.language: exactly what is it that we are\nencouraged to have faith in? And if it is worth cultivating
audio.category: \nhow exactly do we go about doing that? \n

audio.title: Balancing Faith and Wisdom
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: In classical Buddhist psychology these two qualities function as a pair of the Spiritual Faculties - how do they work together? What happens when they get out of balance with each other?\n
audio.language: English

audio.title: Faith
audio.author: the Final Frontier
audio.language: This was a talk given by Ajahn Sucitto on 5.26.07 at Abhayagiri Monastery.

audio.title: Faith or Belief?
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: What\'s the difference between blindly going along with what we\'ve been told
audio.language: and learning to have confidence in the implications of our own experience?\nIs any kind of faith misplaced in genuine spiritual practice?\n

audio.title: The Mind - Curiouser and Curiouser

audio.language: 3rd
audio.category: 2005 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery. Ajahn was just coming off a period of retreat spent here at the monastery and in this talk he reflects on one of the meditation objects he had used during that time.

audio.language: Ajahn Amaro offers reflections on how to deal with the \'Anger-eating Goblins\' that can often arise in our minds.

audio.category: the commemoration of the Buddha\'s first discourse The Dhammacakkappavattana Sutta. During this Dhamma reflection Ajahn Pasanno investigates the theme of this sutta - the Four Noble Truths - and encourages us to reflect for ourselves on these fundamental and essential teachings of the Buddha.

audio.language: 2005). The talk uses awareness as a the main theme

audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno uses the theme of respect as a reflection to incorporate into our day-to-day cultivation of practice.

audio.language: June 18
audio.category: 2005. The talk encourages the developing of skillful means for resting in the present moment.

audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno

audio.title: Precepts

audio.category: Ajahn Pasanno offers reflections on developing skillful means for living peacefully in the world.

audio.title: Rules of Engagement
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Practice means engaging with things at some levelâ€”but does our engagement lead to suffering or not?
audio.language: English

audio.title: Loving Kindness as Your Foundation
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: The importance of wholesome power in the heart.
audio.language: English

audio.title: The Powers of One in Training
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
The role of training in the teaching of the Buddha.

As humans we can train and change our heart.

The Buddha didn't give us a dogma or doctrine to adhere to
audio.language: but a training to be developed. \n\nThe Buddha said the Dhamma would disappear when his disciples loose respect for the teacher
audio.status:
and the training. 

It's important to learn how to skillfully relate to and sustain the training because it's a lifelong persuit.

Examples of how Ajahn Chah demonstrated a excitement and love for training even late in life.

We need to be wise in how we relate to the training
audio.youtube_id: not with delusion. \n\nThe five powers of one in training; faith

audio.language: English

audio.language: English

audio.language: English

audio.title: Choices
audio.author: Ajahn Viradhammo
audio.body: The results of our choices accumulate
audio.language: whether we\'re aware of them or \r\nnot. Ajahn Viradhammo offered this Dhamma reflection when he visited \r\nAbhayagiri in late September 2004.

audio.title: Movement and Stillness
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Movement and Stillness - the complimentary nature of strength and flexibility.
audio.language: English

audio.title: Posture and Focus
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Posture and Focus - the importance of posture
audio.language: both of the body and the mind in balancing the qualities of energy and relaxation.

audio.title: Knowing vs. Thinking
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Knowing vs. Thinking - letting go
audio.language: more and more deeply
audio.category: of the content of our experience
audio.mp3: and learning to witness the process of it.

audio.title: The Giving and Receiving Heart
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: The Giving and Receiving Heart - the realities of cultivating loving-kindness and acceptance as the basis of all meditation.
audio.language: English

audio.title: Hurdles and Pitfalls
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Hurdles and Pitfalls - difficulties in meditation and some ways and means of overcoming them.
audio.language: English

audio.title: Wisdom and Compassion
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Wisdom and Compassion - in many ways
audio.language: wisdom and compassion are necessary counterparts for each other - but how to apply them in terms of meditation?

audio.title: What do I do Now?
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: What do I do Now? - Connnected to the heart
audio.language: aware of the hazards on the Path
audio.category: now what happens? Can we dissolve with compassion the lines between the meditation cushion and the rest of our lives? Can we truly be with the inevitable changing nature of life and also part of a deep transformative intention to ease suffering for all beings? This final class focuses on the realm of activity and will look at examples of how as individuals and groups we might engage our compassionate intentions
audio.mp3: and the attitudes most effective for doing so for the benefit of all.

audio.title: Obstacles to Compassion
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Obstacles to Compassion - Having established that compassion is generally a \"good thing\"(!)
audio.language: what gets in its way? How do we deal with trying too hard
audio.mp3: becoming overwhelmed with pain or with despair
audio.status: losing track of actuality through misguided idealism
audio.user: and other pertinent activist scenarios?\nThis class focuses on the methods of cultivating a truly listening heart
audio.youtube_id: along with counteracting these obstacles and other specific problems.

audio.title: The Basis of Compassion
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: The Basis of Compassion - What is compassion? Can it be cultivated? And if so
audio.language: how? This class focuses mainly on understanding the essential nature of compassion and the core practices for bringing it into being.

He bases the talk on two suttas (one of them AN 8.39) and includes the classic stories of Master Hsu Yun taming bandits on a bus and Ajahn Chah ordaining the hit man paid to kill him. This talk was offered on May 19

audio.mp3: 2012 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery. For more information on the Ten Recollections also consult: A Meditators Tools: A Study Guide on the Ten Recollections by Thanissaro Bhikkhu.

audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno

audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo

audio.language: Brightening the Mind

audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
