audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: In April
audio.language: Ajahn Yatiko lead the Upasika day focusing on the theme of \"The Buddha\". Here Ajahn Yatiko gives some readings from the sutta\'s on characteristics in how the Buddha describes the Tathagata. This Upasika day was held at Abhayagiri on April 22nd

audio.title: Samsara-ing
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo touches on the subject of craving and the mind affected by craving. The 3 forms in which craving manifests are spoken of and their consequences are gently brought to mind. This teaching was given on Sepetember 1st at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.
audio.language: English

audio.title: Anchoring Awareness With The Body
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno explains that although the problems and suffering we experience come from the mind
audio.language: meditation on the body is a valuable tool to ground ourselves in the practice of calm and insight. This teaching was given on August 25th at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: What Are We Living For
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko reflects upon the nature of conventional reality
audio.language: the tendency of our lives to become diffuse
audio.category: and method to bring focus to noble goals and values in our life. This teaching was given on September 9th

audio.title: Using and Investigating the Four Noble Truths
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno offers reflections on the importance of the Four Noble Truths and how to effectively implement them into our practice and experience. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on January 19th

audio.title: Reliance on the Ordinary
audio.author: Ajahn Jayanto
audio.body: During a two-week visit to Abhayagiri Monastery after spending a year on retreat in Thailand
audio.language: Ajahn Jayanto speaks about how the development of lovingkindness requires complete
audio.category: unconditional acceptance of ourselves. This acceptance allows us to release the need to have a secure self-image. Rather than craving to become what we think we should be
audio.mp3: we can develop an awareness that is intrinsic to the mind by paying attention to ordinary experience. This talk was given at Abhayagiri Monastery on November 6

audio.title: Wounded Mind
audio.author: Lightning Mind
audio.body: wounded-mind-lightning-mind-diamond-mind
audio.category: Ajahn Pasanno begins this talk with two similes from the Aṇgutara Nikāya: three kinds of mind (like an open sore
audio.user: AN III.25) and three kinds of medical patients (AN III.22). He then contrasts the noble and ignoble searches for contentment and well-being. Investing tremendous amounts of energy seeking material comfort leads to happiness that vanishes like a flash in the pan. In contrast
audio.youtube_id: the noble search begins with investigating the nature of dis-ease and dissatisfaction and leads to stable

audio.title: Watchful and Available
audio.author: Ajahn Viradhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Viradhammo begins by describing his recent travels to India
audio.language: Laos
audio.category: and China. He warns of two pitfalls that can befall Buddhism as it integrates into culture: ritualism
audio.mp3: which replaces transformative practice with a “good luck religion
audio.user: which mistakes the accumulation of knowledge for wisdom. The skillful contemplative avoids these extremes by using the intellectual structures given by the Buddha to liberate the heart. To this end
audio.youtube_id: Ajahn Viradhammo expresses the traditional teachings on mindfulness in terms of watchfulness and availability. This teaching was given on October 15

audio.title: What is a Monastery For?
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro remarks favorably on the material developments he sees at Abhayagiri Monastery
audio.language: but reminds us that the true purpose of a monastery is to awaken the heart to the potential we have as human beings. We often associate stress with engaged action and peace with retreat and non-engagement
audio.category: but self-view is the actual cause of suffering. Free of this obsessive focus on I
audio.user: the heart can be at ease in the midst of strenuous action. Rather than waiting for his responsibilities as abbot of Amaravati to diminish or become easier
audio.youtube_id: Ajahn Amaro makes the effort open the heart to the present moment as fully and completely as possible.

audio.title: Generosity and Peace
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo reflects on the themes of generosity and peace during the August 2012 Upasika Daylong. This Upasika Day
audio.language: titled Brightening the Mind

audio.title: Generosity and Peace - Questions and Answers
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo answers questions on the themes of generosity and recollection of peace. Topics addressed include whether it is skillful to give with mixed motivation and if it is sometimes a good idea to refuse the gifts of others. This question and answer occurred August 19
audio.language: 2012 during the Upasika Daylong at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Generosity and Peace - Meditation
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: After offering reflections on the themes of generosity and peace
audio.language: Ajahn Karunadhammo concludes the August 2012 Upasika Day with a brief guided meditation that touches on the themes of both giving and letting go. This Upasika Day took place August 19

audio.title: Feeling Abundance Spirit Rock Daylong Entire
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: This is a zip file containing the Dhamma talks
audio.language: guided meditations
audio.mp3: and blessing chants from Ajahn Pasanno\'s September 2012 daylong retreat at Spirit Rock titled \"Feeling Abundance.\" This archive contains a total of 10 mp3 files
audio.user: and may take a while to download.

audio.title: The Zig-Zag Path to Refined Consciousness
audio.author: Ajahn Chandako
audio.body: Ajahn Chandako reflects on many themes including the emptiness of materialism
audio.language: heaven as an interim goal of Buddhist practice
audio.category: pulling weeds as a simile for removing defilements
audio.mp3: and the unshakeable nature of one who has reached the goal. This talk loosely follows the lyrics of a classic 1970s rock song. This teaching was given on September 15

audio.title: Contentment is the Greatest Wealth
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno contrasts the Buddha\'s teachings that contentment is the greatest wealth and one of the highest blessings with messages of modern society which encourage discontent either out of ignorance or to prop up the economy. Part 2 of 10 of the September 2
audio.language: 2012 Feeling Abundance Daylong Retreat at Spirit Rock Meditation Center.

audio.title: Waiting for Ajahn Chah
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno calls abundance “an internal perception of mind” and goes on to tell how he developed patience when Ajahn Chah once made his monks sit through a five-hour Dhamma talk after the fortnightly recitation of the monks\' rules. Part 8 of 10 of the September 2
audio.language: 2012 Feeling Abundance Daylong Retreat at Spirit Rock Meditation Center.

audio.title: The Not-self Strategy
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo finds that contemplating the Buddha\'s teachings on not-self settles the mind even in the absence of deep samādhi. In this talk
audio.language: he describes how the Anattalakkhaṇa Sutta analyzes the five aggregates (body

audio.title: California R. I. P.
audio.author: Ajahn Chandako
audio.body: The two meanings of \"Rest in Peace\"–death and peace–are major themes in Buddhist practice. In this talk
audio.language: Ajahn Chandako stresses how contemplating death straightens out our priorities and developing deep peace allows the mind to rest. He encourages practitioners to investigate
audio.category: \"What is a human body?\" and look below the surface in order to dispel deluded perceptions. He describes how his teachers
audio.status: recommend visually taking the body apart piece by piece in meditation
audio.user: placing each part in front of one

audio.title: The Four Bases of Psychic Potency
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Ajahn Jotipālo further develops the theme of the 2012 Buddhist Bicycle Pilgrimage
audio.language: expounding the Buddha\'s teaching of the four iddhipadas
audio.category: which can be translated as “roads of success” or “bases of power.” These four qualities of desire or interest
audio.user: and discernment are well known in Thai Buddhism but infrequently mentioned in the West. They are necessary to master both worldly and spiritual skills. In the Pāli canon
audio.youtube_id: the iddhipadas usually appear in the context of developing concentration and psychic powers. To develop these themes

audio.title: Our Christian Brothers
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Shortly after returning from Monks in the West III
audio.language: Ajahn Yatiko shares his impressions of this three-day interfaith dialogue between fifteen Buddhist and Christian monks held at the City of Ten Thousand Buddhas. The conference addressed the themes of forming and being formed
audio.status: and caring for elder monks. This teaching was given on October 13

audio.title: The Wholesome Stream
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Reflecting on his life before ordination and twenty years as a monk
audio.language: Ajahn Yatiko discerns two streams of connected events
audio.category: one wholesome and the other unwholesome. He urges listeners to investigate how they can move into the wholesome streams in their own lives. Other themes include the dissatisfaction in endless becoming
audio.mp3: the elemental nature of the body
audio.status: and the search for what is truly meaningful and worthy of faith. This teaching was given on September 29

audio.title: A Shopkeeper\'s Dhamma
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Having just completed a two-week solitary retreat
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno begins this talk with the familiar teaching of the three kinds of solitude–seclusion of body
audio.mp3: and seclusion from the defilements. He then expounds the simile of the shopkeeper (AN III.20). Just as a shopkeeper must have keen eyes
audio.user: and have a benefactor to acquire great wealth
audio.youtube_id: progress in the practice requires a keen eye for the Four Noble Truths

audio.title: Introducing the Gradual Training
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko gives a short overview of the different formulations of the gradual training in the Pāli Canon and the structure of the upasika day. Part 1 of 6 of the October 20
audio.language: 2012 Upasika Day on the gradual training.

audio.title: Coming to the Dhamma
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno explains the most common description of the gradual training
audio.language: which begins with visiting a teacher in whom one has conviction and ends in complete liberation. The full causal chain appears several times in the Pāli Canon
audio.category: for example in MN 95. Part 2 of 6 of the October 20
audio.mp3: 2012 Upasika Day on the gradual training.

audio.title: Gradual Training Questions and Answers 1
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: This track begins with Ajahn Pasanno and Ajahn Yatiko clarifying the analogy of the seed. In response to questions
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno gives examples of grasping the teachings wrongly
audio.category: recommends looking at the results of practice rather than one\'s intentions
audio.mp3: and cautions against trying to convince others of the Buddha\'s teachings. Part 3 of 6 of the October 20
audio.status: 2012 Upasika Day on the gradual training.

audio.title: The Graduated Teaching
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko describes the six-step graduated teaching which appears in (for example) Ud 5.3. In this progressive teaching
audio.language: the Buddha begins by encouraging generosity and virtue and goes on to describe the joys of heaven
audio.status: and the Four Noble Truths. Part 4 of 6 of the October 20
audio.user: 2012 Upasika Day on the gradual training.

audio.title: Monastic Gradual Training
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno expounds the Buddha\'s progressive instructions to monks in MN 39
audio.language: the Maha-Assapura Sutta. In relation to the external world
audio.category: the Buddha recommends cultivating conscience and concern (hiri-otapa)

audio.title: Gradual Training Questions and Answers 2
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno and Ajahn Yatiko answer questions about practices suitable for beginning and advanced practitioners and pitfalls along the path. They recommend beginning with a fundamental confidence that effort will bring results and warn against a purely intellectual grasp of the teachings. The gradual path requires anchoring experience in the body to temper refined mental self-identification. Extreme experiences in meditation are not the goal; you need the clarity and stability to see such experiences as uncertain and impermanent. The ajahns conclude with a discussion of the Buddhist equivalent of the dark night of the soul
audio.language: followed by the Sharing of Blessings chant. Part 6 of 6 of the October 20
audio.category: 2012 Upasika Day on the gradual training.

audio.title: Putting in the Causes
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: In this talk given just after the Upasika Day
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno emphasizes the importance of causality in the Buddha\'s teachings. The gradual training outlines the causes for peace and freedom
audio.category: but it is our choice whether to make effort to bring forth these causes. This teaching was given on October 20

audio.title: Applying Right View in Meditation
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno explains how right view–the understanding of experience in terms of causality and the Four Noble Truths–can be applied in meditation. He urges us to investigate the causal nature of our discontent and dissatisfaction in meditation. Why do we sacrifice the peace and stability of the mind to pursue external objects? Ajahn Pasanno suggests that we will never experience the full benefits of meditation until we question and investigate the ever-present sense of me and mine in terms of clinging to body and mind. This teaching was given on October 23
audio.language: 2012 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Monastic Radical Activism
audio.author: Ajahn Chandako
audio.body: Ajahn Chandako describes Buddhist practice as the radical
audio.language: difficult process of transforming one\'s life from being based on attraction
audio.mp3: and selfishness to being based on what is wholesome and beneficial. The skills needed for this transformation include generosity
audio.user: and sense restraint. If we apply these skills consistently throughout daily life
audio.youtube_id: formal meditation practice will become pleasant and interesting

audio.title: Pavarana Day Community Talks
audio.author: Abhayagiri Sangha
audio.body: Pavarana Day is the final day of the 3-month Vassa retreat period. To celebrate the completion of this period of intensive community practice and vinaya study
audio.language: Ajahn Chah would invite each junior monk to give a short Dhamma reflections
audio.category: and this tradition continues to this day. On October 30
audio.status: Ajahn Pasanno drew names from the Dhamma hall bell and asked the chosen community member to speak. Here are the talks from the community aside from a few minutes lost while we replaced the recorder batteries. 0:00 Tan Ṭhitapañño – Three Refuges; 6:13 Tan Cunda – Golden Retriever 18:03 Tan Khemako – Fighting Scrub Jays; 27:27 Tan Pesalo – Gratitude to Ajahn Paññavaddo (cut off); 38:01 Anāgārika Evan – Spiritual Friends; 42:52 Tan Ṭhitābho – The Four Elements; 55:53 Ajahn Ñāniko – Perception; 1:107:22 Anāgārika Josh – Awareness Is Not What I Think; 1:15:31 Tan Suddhāso – Bahussuta: Much Learning; 1:26:02 Upasika Debbie – Facing Uncertainty; 1:35:34 Sāmaṇera Sudhīro – Challenging Our Preferences; 1:44:36 Tan Kaccāna – Subrahma\'s Verses.

audio.title: Keep Your Feet on the Ground
audio.author: Ajahn Khemavaro
audio.body: Speaking to the Abhayagiri junior monks
audio.language: Ajahn Khemavaro explains that although the monastic life can involve much activity
audio.category: the most important time is spent alone at our kuti getting to know our body and mind. We practice meditation in order to develop the skills we need to be present with our experience
audio.mp3: and deep meditation is more a matter of feeling than thinking. This talk was given on November 28

audio.title: Impressions of Abhayagiri
audio.author: Ajahn Chandako
audio.body: After relating a humorous story of his early years as a monk living with Ajahn Pasanno
audio.language: Ajahn Chandako gives his impressions of the sangha
audio.status: where he had spent the three-month Vassa on retreat. He then explains the role and importance of monastics and monasteries in society. This talk was given at Abhayagiri Monastery on November 3

audio.title: Kathina 2012: Delighting in Generosity
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro
audio.language: founding co-abbot of Abhayagiri Monastery
audio.category: returned to Abhayagiri on the occasion of the 2012 Kathina cloth-giving festival; this was his first visit to California since departing for Amaravati in 2010. Speaking shortly after the sangha received the cloth to a large audience of lay supporters
audio.mp3: Ajahn Amaro delights upon his return and reflects upon the change and development he has seen in sixteen years of Abhayagiri history. He then tells the story of the eight boons Visākhā asks from the Buddha (Vin. Mv. 8:15; Life of the Buddha p. 151). All eight of Visākhā\'s requests were actually gifts she wanted to offer the sangha
audio.status: and Visākhā understood clearly how such generosity aided the sangha and settled her own mind. Ajahn Amaro dispels the notions that the effects of generosity are felt only in future lives and that serious meditators don\'t have time for merit-making. He concludes by emphasizing the distinction between pain and suffering and noting that

audio.title: Accord Without Compromising Principles
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno elucidates Master Hsuan Hua's maxim: “Accord with conditions without compromising principles
audio.language: ” by describing the benefits of following the ten\r\ncourses of wholesome action of body
audio.mp3: and mind described by\r\nthe Buddha. This talk was offered on April 13

audio.title: Four Noble Truths
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Using the Dhammacakkappavattana Sutta\r\nas a template
audio.language: Ajahn Yatiko explains the three aspects of each of the\r\nFour Noble Truths. This talk was offered on April 18

audio.title: Bases of Liberation
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body:
\r\n

Ajahn Karunadhammo addresses the\r\nquestion “Where is peace to be found?” by elucidating AN 5.26
audio.language:
which describes five bases of liberation that lead to successively
higher stages of tranquility and happiness. This talk was offered on
April 10

audio.title: The Elephant\'s Footprint
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno describes the Four Noble Truths using the similes of the elephant's footprint and a medical diagnosis. He then explains the first Noble Truth in terms of three types of dukkha. This talk was offered on April 20
audio.language:
2013 at\r\nAbhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

\r\n

audio.title: What You Came Here For
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Ajahn Jotipalo investigates a number of questions: Why did we come to the monastery? Does our practice address the reasons that we came? Are we staying true to our highest aspirations? This talk was given on November 24
audio.language: 2012 at Abhayagiri Monastery.

audio.title: The Conditioned Path
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko emphasizes the importance of listening to Dhamma talks and studying suttas because although the goal of Buddhist practice is to reach the unconditioned
audio.language: the path of practice itself is conditioned. He draws on the Stoics\' concept of hedonic adaptation to explain the dissatisfaction intrinsic in any conditioned happiness. The search for conditioned happiness often manifests in the creation and maintenance of views and narratives about the self and world. The Brahmajāla Sutta (DN 1) enumerates 62 such views and asserts that all views arise dependent on sense contact. Returning to the direct experience of the six senses can cut through attachment to views. This talk was given on December 8

audio.title: Simplicity
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo brings up the subject of simpicity and the challenges we are faced with it\'s cultivation. This talk was given at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on December 6th

audio.title: Long Enduring Mind
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: Ajahn Nyaniko speaks on the theme of patient endurance and cultivating a \"Long enduring mind\". This talk was given at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on November 21st

audio.title: Simplicity and Relinquishment
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno speaks about the traditional practices and reasons for upholding the lunar observance days. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on November 13th

audio.title: Guided Metta Practice
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Ajahn Jotipalo gives a guided metta meditation to the community and gives many different suggestions in how to cultivate this practice. This guided meditation was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on December 13th

audio.title: Appropriate Attention and Stream Entry
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: During the Monastic Retreat this year
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno touches on the theme of wise
audio.category: or appropriate attention as a supporting factor for stream entry. This talk was given at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa on November 18th

audio.title: Death Contemplation
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: On the Monastic Retreat this year
audio.language: Ajahn Karunadhammo offers some reflections on the universal characteristic of impermanence and how it is reflected in the body. This talk was given on November 19th
audio.category: 2012 at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa during the Annual Monastic Retreat.

audio.title: Reflections on the Holidays
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo reflects on this cold and rainy night some of the bigger questions in life like
audio.language: \"What is this all about?\". This talks was give on December 15th

audio.title: Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat 2012 Entire
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: This is a 290 MB zip file of the 27 talks given by Ajahn Pasanno
audio.language: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.mp3: and Debbie Stamp at the 2012 Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat in Santa Rosa
audio.status: California from November 16 to 25. Open the index.html file to see a chronological list of talks and speakers. These talks are also available for online browsing (opens in new tab) and request as part of the 2014 Winter Retreat DVD Collection.

audio.title: Our Great Good Fortune
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: Ajahn Nyaniko gives some Dhamma reflections on the Winter Solstice
audio.language: reminding us of our good fortune to have come across teachings that lead to liberation from suffering and then encourages us to put forth effort into the practice. This talk was offered on December 21st

audio.title: The Uposatha Observance
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko speaks about the practice of taking up the 8 precepts for the Lunar Observance\'s on the Buddhist Calendar. This talks was offered on December 28th
audio.language: 2012 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Preparing for the Winter Retreat
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Ajahn Jotipalo gives some reflections and advice on entering the Winter Retreat for the community relating some of his own past experiences in past years. This reflection was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on December 29th

audio.title: Cycles
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo reflects on various cycles of nature
audio.language: the world
audio.mp3: and life and offers suggestions for using cycles as opportunities to stop and reflect. This reflection was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on December 31st

audio.title: Thailand Reflections and Foundations of Steady Practice
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on his recent trip to Thailand
audio.language: and talks about faith
audio.mp3: and generosity as deep foundations for steady
audio.status: meaningful practice. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on January 5th

audio.title: Tools for the Hindrances
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Starting the Winter Retreat of 2013
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno offers a variety of tools for use in practice to help work with the hindrances. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on January 11th

audio.title: The Cultivation of Skillful Qualities
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.language: reflecting on recent readings of the Five Hindrances
audio.category: talks about what the Canon defines as skillful qualities and how keeping sensitivity
audio.status: and effort present in our practice helps with the cultivation of these skillful qualities and leads to greater wisdom in what is ultimately to our benefit and what is to our detriment. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on January 26th

audio.title: The First Minute of Practice
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Ajahn Jotipalo reflects on the first minute of practice and its importance in setting the tone for the period
audio.language: recollects interesting movements of the mind
audio.category: and offers the Four Bases of Power as a framework for looking at our meditation. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on February 3rd

audio.title: Seeing Dukkha
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: Ajahn Naniko reflects on the different varieties and forms of dukkha and advises of the importance of spending time with it to cool the heart. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on February 18th

audio.title: The Importance of Impermanence
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the importance of working with and noticing impermanence
audio.language: inconstancy
audio.mp3: and in ending recollects how a real sense of impermanence gives rise to gratitude. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on February 2nd

audio.title: Daring to Give
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the quality of daring and courage in our practice. When we let go of the comfort of concepts and allow ourselves a place of vulnerability to experience we find a place which cultivates true understanding and growth. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on February 9th

audio.title: The Delusion of Forever
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo recollects the Five Khandas focusing on our tendency to read stability and reliability into something which can ultimately only bring disappointment. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on February 10th

audio.title: Continuity and Inspiration
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the need for consistency and sustained continuity in our practice
audio.language: how to strike a balance between sitting and walking meditation
audio.category: and how to use inspiration to help move us through the natural lows in practice and find that balance of \"just right\" effort. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on February 16th

audio.title: A Lamp for Seeing Clearly
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno offers the theme of death as a worthwhile contemplation. Removing worry and fear about death by contemplating this fundamental reality puts things in a clear perspective and creates a simplifying sense of ease with the true understanding of the way things are. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on February 23rd

audio.title: Magha Puja 2013
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno recollects the teachings of the Magha Puja. The full moon of February when the Buddha gave a summary of the teachings to a group of 1250 enlightened beings who had gathered on that day of practice and observance. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on February 25th

audio.title: To Look with Kindly Eyes
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the importance of cultivating the quality of loving kindness in our practice. From helping strengthen concentration to establishing harmony and happiness to just being really good kamma
audio.language: metta has a wide range of benefits and deserves our attention. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on March 2nd

audio.title: Loving Kindness and the Flow of Practice
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Ajahn Jotipalo reflects on loving kindness and shares the ebb & flow of his practice experience taking it as a primary meditation object for an extended period of time. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on March 5th

audio.title: The Middle Way Out of Samsara
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the meaning of samsara and how to use anicca
audio.language: dukkha
audio.category: and anatta to put down burdens
audio.status: and find a real refuge resting in an awareness that knows clearly. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on March 9th

audio.title: Zooming Out the Map
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo reflects on the importance of keeping the whole perspective after or during a period of intensive focus into one area. He goes through a variety of techniques and reflections that are useful grounding points to keep things in the wider picture of our practice. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on March 11th

audio.title: What Do We Pick Up?
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on our extraordinarily good conditions as well as the nature of the mind to pick up habits
audio.language: thoughts
audio.status: and perceptions. When we go to pick up a thought or a mood
audio.user: is it wholesome or is it just another piece of rubbish? Reflecting on our good fortune and our desire to pick up what is wholesome and skillful
audio.youtube_id: if we are going to go about picking things up

audio.title: Hindrances and Factors of Enlightenment
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: Ajahn Naniko offers many helpful tools and much inspiration for skillfully allowing hindrances to fade and planting causes for the enlightenment factors to grow. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on March 19th

audio.title: Breath as a Basis for Joy and Clarity
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflecting on a need at times to return to basics offers the breath as a vehicle for joy and clarity to arise by simply being present with the rhythms of breathing. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on March 23rd

audio.title: To the End and Beyond
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Ajahn Jotipalo shares some of his experiences and advice for working with the changeover in the mind that takes place when we approach the end of a period of retreat. Using his experience with loving-kindness meditation he explores the questions of what can we look for as the retreat draws to a close and how can we adapt what we have learned to more daily life? This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on March 26th

audio.title: Becoming Skilled in Applying Dhamma
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno talks about the importance of bringing Dhamma out from the recipe book and into the action of daily life. In line with the theme of the winter retreat he reflects on and offers suggestions of mental qualities that are beneficial in accomplishing this. This talk was offered at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on March 30th

audio.title: Reflections from Sri Lanka
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko reflects upon his recent three-month pilgrimage to Sri Lanka with Ajahn Saññamo. External events include seeing the Kelaniya Temple
audio.language: an exhausting climb up Adam\'s Peak
audio.category: and a visit with Bhante Ñanadipa. The most valuable internal aspect of the pilgrimage was reflecting on the subjective perception of impermanence using the question “Do I believe in rebirth?” This talk was offered on April 6

audio.title: Right Livelihood Upasika Day
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reads from P. A. Payutto's Buddhist Economics and A Constitution for Living and answers questions related to the topic of right livelihood. This talk was offered on April 21
audio.category:
at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery\r\nduring the Right Livelihood Upasika Day.

\r\n

audio.title: Right Livelihood Questions and Answers
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

After\r\na period of small-group discussion
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno answers more questions about right livelihood from the upasikas. This talk was offered on April 21
audio.mp3:
at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery\r\nduring the Right Livelihood Upasika Day.

\r\n

audio.title: Faith on Mississippi Tudong
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Ajahn Jotipālo\r\nrecounts the role of saddhā
audio.language: which can be translated as\r\nfaith
audio.status: during his pilgrimage up the\r\nMississippi River. This talk was offered on April 25

audio.title: Touching the Breath with Compassion
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno urges to meditate with the attitude of touching or experiencing the breath and body rather than watching or seeing and emphasizes the importance of bringing kindness and compassion to our meditation. This talk was offered on April 27
audio.language:
2013 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

\r\n

audio.title: Work as Practice
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: Ajahn Ñaniko describes the role and importance of work in Ajahn Chah's way of practice and goes on to explain two gathas from The Zen Verses of Stonehouse. This talk was offered on May 3
audio.language:
\r\n2013 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

\r\n

audio.title: Foundations of the Holy Life
audio.author: Ajahn Dtun
audio.body: After the\r\nordination of Sāmaṇera Suhajjo and Anāgārika Anthony
audio.language:
Tan Ajahn
Dtun gives advice to the new monastics and reflects on the role of
right view and renunciation in the Holy Life. This talk was given on
May 5
audio.category:
2013 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery and was translated by Ajahn\r\nTejapañño.

\r\n

audio.title: Questions and Answers 1
audio.author: Ajahn Dtun
audio.body: Ajahn Dtun answers\r\nquestions regarding insight and concentration
audio.language: sensuality
audio.mp3: and the removal of life support from terminally\r\nill patients. This question and answer session occurred on May 6
audio.status: 2013 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery and was translated by Ajahn Tejapañño.

audio.title: Cutting Out Attachment to the Body
audio.author: Ajahn Dtun
audio.body: After telling an\r\nanecdote from the day\'s almsround
audio.language:
Ajahn Dtun goes on to describe the
path to liberation. He emphasizes the importance of keeping precepts
and then explains how contemplating the true nature of the body leads
to each of the four stages of liberation. This talk was offered on
May 9
audio.category:
2013 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery and was translated by\r\nAjahn Tejapañño.

\r\n

audio.title: Is the Knife Sharp?
audio.author: Ajahn Dtun
audio.body: Ajahn Dtun answers\r\nthe common question: When developing concentration
audio.language: how will we know\r\nwhen it is time to contemplate the body? This question was asked on\r\nMay 9
audio.category:
2013 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery and was translated by\r\nAjahn Tejapañño.

\r\n

audio.title: A Sphere of Clarity in the Heart
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Citing AN 3.73
audio.language: \r\nAjahn Pasanno reiterates that the fulfillment of the path is built on\r\nthe foundation of virtue
audio.user: and clarity in the practice.\r\nThis talk was offered on May 17

audio.title: Using Ritual Skillfully
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body:
\r\n

Ajahn Jotipālo describes how the rituals of our practice such chanting
audio.language: bowing to\r\nthe shrine
audio.mp3: and taking monastic\r\nordination can support our practice and brighten and settle the mind.\r\nThis talk was offered on May 18

audio.title: Where Body and Mind Meet
audio.author: Ajahn Sucitto
audio.body:
\r\n

On the occasion of\r\nthe Buddha\'s birth
audio.language: Awakening
audio.mp3: Ajahn Sucitto urges\r\nus to keep returning to the point where body and mind meet. This is\r\nthe field of practice where the Buddha arises
audio.youtube_id: and resolve the world (SN 2.26). This talk was offered on\r\nVesak

audio.title: Maranassati: The End of the Future
audio.author: Ajahn Sucitto
audio.body: Ajahn Sucitto contemplates death by taking each step knowing that it might be the last. What happens if we remove the perception of permanence
audio.language: continuity
audio.category: and the sense of “next” from our\r\nexperience of meditation? This partially recorded talk was offered on\r\nMay 25

audio.title: คำถามที่พบบ่อย 2: อาตมาปฏิบัติมาอย่างนี้
audio.author: Ajahn Dtun
audio.body: ในช่วงเวลา 3 ชั่วโมงของการไขปัญหาธรรม พระอาจารย์ตั๋นได้ตอบคำถามเกี่ยวกับการออกเดินธุดงค์
audio.language: \r\nความสามัคคีในหมู่คณะ
audio.category: \r\nการไม่ทำตามความชอบใจหรือความไม่ชอบใจ

audio.status: \r\nการศึกษาพระสูตร

audio.title: การตัดความยึดมั่นถือมั่นในกาย
audio.author: Ajahn Dtun
audio.body: พระอาจารย์ตั๋นเล่าถึงประสบการณ์บิณฑบาตในเมืองยูไคย่าห์ของท่าน และบรรยายพระธรรมเทศนาเกี่ยวกับหนทางสู่พระนิพพาน ท่านได้เน้นถึงความสำคัญของการรักษาศีล และอธิบายว่าการพิจารณากายสามารถนำไปสู่การบรรลุธรรมทั้งสี่ขั้นได้ พระอาจารย์ตั๋นได้แสดงพระธรรมเทศนานี้ในคืนวันที่ 9 พฤษภาคม 2556 ที่วัดป่าอภัยคีรี และพระธรรมเทศนานี้ได้รับการแปลเป็นภาษาอังกฤษโดยอาจารย์เตชปัญโญ
audio.language: Thai

audio.title: มีดนี้คมหรือไม่?
audio.author: Ajahn Dtun
audio.body: พระอาจารย์ตั๋นตอบคำถามหนึ่งซึ่งพบบ่อย คือขณะที่ทำสมาธิอยู่นั้น เราจะทราบได้อย่างไรว่าควรจะพิจารณากายได้แล้ว คำถามนี้ถูกถามในคืนวันที่ 9 พฤษภาคม 2556 ที่วัดป่าอภัยคีรี และได้รับการแปลเป็นภาษาอังกฤษโดยอาจารย์เตชปัญโญ
audio.language: Thai

audio.title: คำถามที่พบบ่อย 1
audio.author: Ajahn Dtun
audio.body: \r\nพระอาจารย์ตั๋นได้ตอบคำถามเกี่ยวกับญาณและสมาธิ
audio.language: \r\nราคะ
audio.category: \r\nการควบคุมจิต
audio.mp3: และการถอดเครื่องช่วยหายใจออกจากผู้ป่วยระยะสุดท้าย การไขปัญหาธรรมนี้เกิดขึ้นในคืนวันที่ 6 พฤษภาคม 2556 ที่วัดป่าอภัยคีรี และได้รับการแปลเป็นภาษาอังกฤษโดยอาจารย์เตชปัญโญ

audio.title: รากฐานของชีวิตสมณะ
audio.author: Ajahn Dtun
audio.body: หลังจากเสร็จสิ้นพิธีบวชของสามเณรสุหัชโชและอนาคาริกแอนโธนี พระอาจารย์ตั๋นได้ให้คำแนะนำแก่นักบวชใหม่และให้ข้อคิดเกี่ยวกับสัมมาทิฏฐิและเนกขัมมะในชีวิตสมณะ พระอาจารย์ตั๋นได้แสดงพระธรรมเทศนานี้ในคืนวันที่ 5 พฤษภาคม 2556 ที่วัดป่าอภัยคีรี และพระธรรมเทศนานี้ได้รับการแปลเป็นภาษาอังกฤษโดยอาจารย์เตชปัญโญ

audio.title: Generosity of Heart
audio.author: Ajahn Candasiri
audio.body: <span style=\"font-size:9.0pt;font-family:\" arial\
audio.language: \"sans-serif\";color:#333333\"=\"\"><font size=\"3\">Ajahn Candasiri speaks about generosity in terms of what we can give to ourselves - reducing our suffering by removing jealousy and other imperfections of the heart.  This talk was offered on June 8

audio.title: Recall Your Inital Resolve
audio.author: Reverend Heng Sure
audio.body: Reverend Heng Sure advises a newly-ordained monk to recall his initial resolve to seek the end of suffering when practice becomes difficult and then describes a compassionate admonishment from his teacher
audio.language: Master Hsuan Hua. This\r\nexhortation concluded Sudhīro Bhikkhu\'s ordination on June 16

audio.title: The Relevance of Monastic Training
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno and Ajahn Yatiko describe how the monk's discipline has influenced Thai culture and reflect upon how Westerners could integrate elements from the monastic form into their lives. This teaching introduced the June 15

audio.title: Peace and Joy
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on peace and joy
audio.language: and gives some guided meditation instructions.  This talk was offered on June 1
audio.category: 2013 at the Mindfulness Care Center in San Francisco
audio.mp3: as part of a Yoga/Meditation Daylong with Cator Shachoy.

audio.title: Conditional Causality
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo describes kamma and causality according to the Theravada Buddhist tradition
audio.language: contrasted with the concepts of karma presented in other spiritual philosophies.  This talk was offered on June 22

audio.title: Observing Cessation
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno uses observation of arising and ceasing as the basis for giving reflections on formal meditation practice.  This talk was offered on June 23
audio.language: 2013 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Gentleness
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Ajahn Jotipālo presents some tactics for approaching loving-kindness meditation
audio.language: using the example of focusing on the aspect of gentleness.  This talk was offered on June 29

audio.title: Principles of Walking Meditation
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno provides an overview of how to do walking meditation.  This talk was offered on June 1
audio.language: 2013 at the Mindfulness Care Center in San Francisco
audio.category: as part of a Yoga/Meditation Daylong with Cator Shachoy.

audio.title: Pāramī
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno describes the ten Pāramī as means of crossing over from confusion to clarity. This\r\ntalk was offered\r\non July 6

audio.title: Control
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo urges us to investigate the questions: “What can we control?” and “How much control do we really have?” in order to loosen the grip of unskillful habits and perceptions of self. This talk was offered on July 7

audio.title: Sacred Uncertainty: Our West Coast Pilgrimage
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: Ajahn Ñaniko describes his recent pilgrimage from Abhayagiri Monastery to Pacific Hermitage with Tan Ṭhitabho including many stories of unexpected kindness and generosity from strangers. This talk was offered on July 15

audio.title: Standing at Markets: More Pilgrimage Tales
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: Ajahn Ñaniko fills a second Dhamma talk with remarkable stories from the pilgrimage between Abhayagiri Monastery and Pacific Hermitage. This talk was offered on July 21

audio.title: Really Being Honest and Truthful
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno gives encouragement to be honest in assessing the realities of the condition we're in. The resolution to dukkha “isn't in trying to find an iron-clad
audio.language: up-lifting
audio.category:
and up-lifted personality and
identity” but in a more basic and fundamental approach viewing
experience through the lens of the Four Noble Truths. This talk was
offered on Asalha Puja July 22

audio.title: Vinaya: The Structure of Our Life
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body:
\r\n

Ajahn Jotipalo\r\ngives an overview of Vinaya
audio.language: the Monastic Discipline
audio.category: and how it is\r\nstudied and practiced at Abhayagiri. This talk was offered on July\r\n22

audio.title: Anagarika JR Ordination Procedure and Talk
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno leads resident layman JR through the Anagarika Ordination Procedure and offers reflections on living as a renunciate with an enjoinder from the suttas: “Don't pollute yourself.” This talk was offered on July 30

audio.title: Post Ordination Comment
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko offers a short 1 minute comment/confession following and alluding to the talk given by Ajahn Pasanno at JR's ordination. Listen to Ajahn Pasanno's: “Anagarika JR Ordination Procedure and Talk” first before listening to this track. This comment was made on July 30

audio.title: Relinquishing the Burden
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

In\r\nthis talk given during the Spirit Rock Teen Weekend
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno\r\ngives advice on choosing one\'s burdens
audio.mp3: and on putting down unsatisfactory burdens which “don't quite satisfy.” This talk was offered on July 13

audio.title: I Love You!...Get A Job!
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo offers reflections on 4 of the “Eight Worldly Winds”- praise and blame; status and loss of status – noticing how easily we get buffeted by these conditions and suggesting how we can face them more skillfully to find a more pure state of peace. This talk was given on August 3

audio.title: Goal-Oriented and Source-Oriented Practice
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno draws a distinction between “goal-oriented practice” which focuses on realizing successive stages along the path using specific techniques and methods and “source-oriented practice” which centers around having the qualities of awareness and clarity in the present moment. “It isn't as if one is right and one is wrong...or one is always right/wrong for me...but its about learning how to recognize: 'What's actually working?'” This talk was given on August 10

audio.title: Upasika Day-Part 2 (Meditation Instructions)
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno leads the Upasika group in a guided meditation. This talk was given on August 11

audio.title: Upasika Day-Part 3 (Questions & Answers)
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: In this short segment
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno answers questions which came up during the first part of the Upasika Day on the theme of “Calming the Busy Mind.” This talk was given on August 11

audio.title: Upasika Day-Part 1 (Preliminaries: Creating A Shrine & Chanting)
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno begins the Upasika Day themed “Calming the Busy Mind
audio.language: ” with advice on cultivating the devotional aspect of practice with specific emphasis on creating a shrine and chanting. This talk was given on August 11

audio.title: Upasika Day-Part 4 (Right Attitude: Readings from Ajahn Chah)
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: In this section of the Upasika Day
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno discusses the attitude which we carry into the practice of calming the busy mind drawing upon several short readings from Ajahn Chah: “Receiving Visitors
audio.mp3: ” and “Better than No Rice.” This talk was given on August 11

audio.title: Upasika Day-Part 5 (Questions and Answers2)
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: More questions and answers dealing with the theme of the busy mind. This dialog occurred on August 11

audio.title: Upasika Day-Part 6 (MN 20: The Removal of Distracting Thoughts)
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: In this conclusion to the Upasika day on Calming the Busy Mind
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno examines in detail the Sutta on The Removal of Distracting Thoughts (MN 20) along with short readings from several other related suttas (MN 2
audio.mp3: S 35.13) and answers various interspersed questions on these topics. This talk was given on August 11

audio.title: The Beautiful and Enjoyable Path
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karunadhammo reflects on his own personal search to “enjoy life to the fullest;” from a typical worldly feast at the banquet of the senses on to a growing appreciation for the beauty and pleasure of the path of virtue
audio.language: meditation
audio.category: and insight that the Buddha layed out. This talk was given on August 14

audio.title: Friendship SR Daylong-Part 9 (Q & A 3)
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno answers more questions on spiritual friendship
audio.language: simplicity
audio.status: and discerning what is “right.” This Q &A took place on June 22
audio.youtube_id: at Spirit Rock Meditation Center as part of a daylong teaching themed “The Whole of the Path: The Fruits of Spiritual Friendship.”

audio.title: Friendship SR Daylong-Part 8 (Guided Meditation-Waking and Knowing)
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno gives a guided meditation on waking up to and knowing clearly the experience of the breath
audio.language: the body
audio.category: and the mind. This meditation was given on June 22
audio.status: at Spirit Rock Meditation Center as part of a daylong teaching themed “The Whole of the Path: The Fruits of Spiritual Friendship.”

audio.title: Friendship SR Daylong-Part 7 (Q & A 2)
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno responds to the question of taking responsibility for our friendships and explains the distinctions between seclusion
audio.language: dispassion
audio.mp3: and maturing-in-release. This Q &A took place on June 22
audio.user: at Spirit Rock Meditation Center as part of a daylong teaching themed “The Whole of the Path: The Fruits of Spiritual Friendship.”

audio.title: Friendship SR Daylong-Part 5 (Alms Explanation & Anumodana)
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno explains the Buddhist monk's physical dependency on gifts of food from lay people and relates the on-going experiences of 2 monks on alms pilgrimage in America. This short talk is followed by the traditional
audio.language: pre-meal “Anumodana” chanting of gratitude for the food offered. This talk was given on June 22
audio.mp3: at Spirit Rock Meditation Center as part of a daylong teaching themed “The Whole of the Path: The Fruits of Spiritual Friendship.”

audio.title: Friendship SR Daylong-Part 4 (Guided Meditation-Recollections)
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno leads the group in a brief guided meditation introducing a method of bringing to mind recollections of one's generosity
audio.language: one\'s own virtue
audio.youtube_id: and Sangha as a way to calm and brighten the\r\nmind. This meditation was given on June 22

audio.title: Friendship SR Daylong-Part 3 (Q &A 1)
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno answers questions on the subject of cultivating wise friendships and letting go of unwise friendships. This Q &A took place on June 22
audio.category: at Spirit Rock Meditation Center as part of a daylong teaching themed “The Whole of the Path: The Fruits of Spiritual Friendship.”

audio.title: Friendship SR Daylong-Part 6 (The 8-Fold Path & Its Supports)
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno examines the second half of the famous “Half of the Holy Life” Sutta (SN 45.2) drawing out the meaning of the qualities of seclusion
audio.language: dispassion
audio.status: and Right View and noting\r\nhow these are nurtured by good spiritual friendship. Amidst several\r\nsutta readings from the Magga-Samyutta (On the Path)
audio.user: Ajahn Pasanno fields the question: “What would the Buddha say regarding climate change?” This talk was given on June 22

audio.title: Friendship SR Daylong-Part 1 (Introduction and Guided Meditation-Settling)
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno begins this Spirit Rock Daylong with a guided meditation on settling into the present in an open and spacious way accepting things the way they are. This talk was given on June 22
audio.category: at Spirit Rock Meditation Center as part of a daylong teaching themed “The Whole of the Path: The Fruits of Spiritual Friendship.”

audio.title: Friendship SR Daylong-Part 2 (Sutta Readings on Spiritual Friendship)
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reads and offers some reflection on several suttas which touch upon the importance of cultivating good spiritual friendship including the well known “Half of the Holy Life” Sutta (SN 45.2). Other suttas read and examined include “The Conditions of Welfare” Sutta (AN 8.54) praising association with and emulation of those consummate in virtue
audio.language: confidence
audio.mp3: and discernment; and Iti 1.17 extolling good spiritual friendship as the most important external factor in attaining the hearts release. This talk was given on June 22
audio.user: at Spirit Rock Meditation Center as part of a daylong teaching themed “The Whole of the Path: The Fruits of Spiritual Friendship.”

audio.title: An Integrated Path
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno describes how the Buddhist path begins with training in\r\nprecepts
audio.language: continues with integrating the experience of body
audio.mp3:
and heart and culminates by developing a truth discerning awareness
which is not intimidated by uncertainty and change. This talk was
given on August 21

audio.title: Reflections on Death
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Ajahn\r\nJotipalo explores the theme of death
audio.language: outlining a variety of\r\ndifferent ways to bring the practice inward. This talk was given on\r\nAugust 17

audio.title: Don\'t Talk Dhamma on Drugs
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Following an unpleasant encounter with a yellow jacket
audio.language: Ajahn\r\nJotipalo shares reflections on the beauty of renunciation
audio.category: and\r\nexamines the ways in which the monastic precepts can help to foster\r\nits growth. This talk was given on August 24

audio.title: The Gradual Training & This-That Conditionality
audio.author: Ajahn Viradhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Viradhammo elucidates the Gradual Path of Training using themes of generosity
audio.language: gratitude and this-that conditionality.

audio.title: Truth Discerning Awareness
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno explores the practice of mindfulness and clear\r\ncomprehension
audio.language: reflecting on ways in which to cultivate this “Truth\r\nDiscerning Awareness”. This talk was given on August 29

audio.title: Settling the Mind
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno gives practical advice on settling the mind
audio.language: as well as\r\ncultivating the ability to see things clearly. This talk was given\r\non September 4

audio.title: Space of Goodness
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Reflecting on the insights from a recent two-week retreat
audio.language: Ajahn\r\nKarunadhammo describes a “space of goodness” arising from\r\ndedicated
audio.category: long-term practice which can be discerned amidst the\r\nmind\'s activity. This talk was given on September 14

audio.title: Starving and Feeding
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno describes the Buddha's imagery of either starving or feeding the five hindrances and starving or feeding the seven factors of awakening as a tool for meditation and daily life practice. This talk was given on September 19

audio.title: Do It Well
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: Reflecting on the certainty of aging and death and the uncertainty of\r\nlife
audio.language: Ajahn Ñāniko urges us: “Whatever you do
audio.mp3: ” and\r\ngives practical examples from monastic life: bowing
audio.user: and\r\ncleaning your dwelling. This talk was given on September 21

audio.title: At Peace with Dukkha
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno gives reflections on how to live at peace in an\r\nunsatisfactory world. This talk was given on September 12
audio.language: 2013 at\r\nAbhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Letting Go
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Ajahn Jotipalo responds to a recent question about practice- “Why\r\ndo we call it letting go”? This talk was given on August 31
audio.language: 2013\r\nat Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: The Centrality of Dana
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Reflecting upon several ongoing events at the monastery
audio.language: Ajahn\r\nJotipālo emphasizes the centrality of dana (generosity) to communal\r\nharmony and the monastic life. This talk was given on September 27

audio.title: Beyond the Normal Limits
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: The evening after the weekly late-night meditation vigil
audio.language: Ajahn\r\nKaruṇadhammo reflects that purpose of such strenuous observances is\r\nto develop the pāramī of energy
audio.mp3: and patience. This talk\r\nwas given on September 28

audio.title: A Well-Thatched Mind
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Referring to the simile of the well-thatched roof (Dhp 13-14)
audio.language: Ajahn\r\nPasanno describes the process and benefits of training the mind to\r\nrealize radical liberation beyond the floods of sensuality
audio.status: and ignorance. This talk was given on October 4

audio.title: Taking Responsibility
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: Ajahn Ñāniko explains how right view requires taking responsibility for our perceptions and emotions and goes on to describe moderation in eating and devotion to wakefulness as aspects of the monastic gradual training. This talk was given on October 5

audio.title: Generosity
audio.author: Endurance
audio.body: generosity-endurance-and-restraint
audio.category: Ajahn Ñāniko expounds on the Buddha\'s teaching that one should\r\nassociate with a friend who gives what is hard to give
audio.mp3: does what is hard to do
audio.status: and endures what\r\nis hard to endure (AN 3.135). <span style=\"background-color: rgb(255

audio.title: Gladden Your Own Mind
audio.author: Ajahn Jayasaro
audio.body: Ajahn Jayasaro emphasizes the importance of gladness in Buddhist practice and recommends meditation techniques such as recollecting our own generosity and goodness to gladden the mind. This talk was given on October 19

audio.title: Kathina: A Celebration of Harmony
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: In a short English talk
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno explains how Kathina\r\ncelebrates the harmony between and among the monastic Sangha and lay\r\ncommunity. This talk was given on October 20

audio.title: บุญและการปฏิบัติธรรม
audio.author: Ajahn Jayasaro
audio.body: พระอาจารย์ชยสาโรได้อธิบายความหมายที่แท้จริงของบุญและการปฏิบัติธรรมว่าคือการ “ศึกษา” ที่ต้องทำ ณ ปัจจุบันขณะ ไม่ใช่รอไว้ทำตอนอายุมากแล้ว และต้องทำในที่ทุกๆแห่งไม่ใช่แต่เฉพาะที่วัดเท่านั้น พระอาจารย์เสริมว่าการรักษาศีลถือเป็นการทำบุญ และเตือนว่าคนไทยควรระวังเรื่องการพูดนินทาและการใช้เทคโนโลยีพร่ำเพรื่อ พระอาจารย์ชยสาโรได้แสดงพระธรรมเทศนานี้ในวันที่ 20 ตุลาคม 2556 ในงานกฐินที่วัดป่าอภัยคีรี
audio.language: Thai

audio.title: The Happiness of Giving
audio.author: Ajahn Jayasaro
audio.body: Just before giving Thai Kathina talk
audio.language: Ajahn Jayasaro reflects on\r\nthemes of mudita (sympathetic joy)
audio.mp3: and patience endurance in English.\r\nThis short reflection was given on October 20

audio.title: 2013 Kathina Ceremony
audio.author: Abhayagiri Sangha
audio.body: This recording begins with Ajahn Pasanno welcoming Ajahn Jayasaro and\r\nthe Kathina visitors and explaining the 2
audio.language:
500-year old Kathina
ceremony. The lay supporters then take the Three Refuges and Five
Precepts and the monks chant blessings in Pāli. The lay supporters
offer cloth to the Sangha
audio.category: who in turn bestow it upon the recipient\r\nof this year\'s Kathina robe.

audio.title: Foundations of Practice
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Using the simile of the unfinished Reception Hall
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno\r\nemphasizes the importance of laying a solid foundation of stability\r\nof mind
audio.mp3: and continuity of awareness for success in\r\nthe practice. This talk was offered on October 26

audio.title: Look After Each Other
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Ajahn Jotipālo reflects on Ajahn Pasanno\'s instructions to “look\r\nafter each other” and investigates the mental states of metta
audio.language: \r\nkaruna
audio.mp3: and patience which conduce to communal harmony. This\r\ntalk was offered on October 27

audio.title: Abhayagiri 2013 Winter Retreat
audio.author: Abhayagiri Sangha
audio.body: This 340 MB zip file contains all the readings and reflections from the Abhayagiri 2013 Winter Retreat
audio.language: which focus on mindfulness of mind objects (dhammas). After an introductory series of talks on meditation
audio.status: and Ajahn Jotipālo read selections from the Pāli canon and other sources focused on the five hindrances

audio.title: Those Who See the Danger
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: Ajahn Ñaniko weaves together the daily routine at Abhayagiri Monastery
audio.language: the Thai Forest practice of “Buddho
audio.category: ” and the Pāli Canon teachings on the first stage of enlightenment around the central thread of seeing danger in the cycle of existence. This talk was offered on November 2

audio.title: Authenticity and Freedom
audio.author: Ajahn Yatiko
audio.body: Ajahn Yatiko reflects on his brother Glenn\'s life
audio.language: values
audio.category:
and
suicide from the perspective of a “Siamese twin joined at the soul”
and from the perspective of a Buddhist monk. Originally offered at
Glenn's memorial service on September 30
audio.user: this talk was replayed on November 10

audio.title: Our Bubble of Reality
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo reflects upon how we frequently skip from one\r\nmanufactured perceptual world to the next without recognizing the\r\nunderlying element of change. This talk was offered on November 9

audio.title: I
audio.author: Me
audio.body: i-me-and-mine
audio.category: Ajahn Pasanno investigates how mana (conceit) manifests as the\r\nsense of “I
audio.user: ” and causes suffering and\r\ncomplication. This talk was offered on November 17

audio.title: Begin Well
audio.author: End Well
audio.language: Ajahn Jotipālo elucidates two aphorisms: “There is no way to\r\npeace; peace is the way
audio.category: ” and Bhante Dhammavaro\'s advice to the\r\nyoung Ajahn Sona: “If you begin well
audio.mp3: you will end well.” This\r\ntalk was offered on November 30

audio.title: Anapanasati - 19 Talks from Winter Retreat 2005
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno gave this series of Dhamma Talks on the stages of Anāpānasati (mindfulness of in and out breathing) to the community at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery from the 4th to \r\nthe 22nd of January
audio.category: during the annual Winter Retreat. These talks can be downloaded as a single 362 MB .zip archive; the contents are identical to the free distribution CD. The CD contents are also available for online browsing (opens in new tab) and request as part of the 2014 Winter Retreat DVD Collection.

audio.title: Viriya - 26 Talks from Winter Retreat 2005
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno gave this series of sutta readings and commentary on Viriya (energy) during the daily teachings offered to the resident community of \r\nAbhayagiri during the Winter Retreat of 2005. The inspiration for this \r\nseries of teachings arose from
audio.language: and is based upon
audio.category: a series on the same \r\nsubject offered by Ajahn Sucitto at the Barre Center for Buddhist \r\nStudies in Massachusetts. These talks can be downloaded as a single 495 MB .zip archive; the contents are identical to the free distribution CD. The CD contents are also available for online browsing (opens in new tab) and request as part of the 2014 Winter Retreat DVD Collection.

audio.title: The Forces of Nature
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: A painted sign on the Abhayagiri trails quotes Ajahn Chah: “Everything we need to know we can learn from nature.” Ajahn Karuṇadhammo uses the message and gradual deterioration of this sign to remind us of the universality of uncertainty and impermanence. This talk was offered on December 2

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Taking Precepts
audio.author: Introduction
audio.body: monastic-retreat-2013%3A-taking-precepts%2C-introduction%2C-and-chanting
audio.category: After giving the refuges and precepts
audio.mp3: Ajahn Pasanno begins the retreat with some announcements
audio.status: general encouragement and a basic introduction to the retreat life. This talk was offered on Nov. 22
audio.user: day 1 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Experimenting with the Breath
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno leads the group in a guided breath meditation and encourages us to experiment to find out what works for ourselves. This guided meditation was offered on Nov. 23
audio.language: day 2 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Walking Meditation not Wandering Meditation
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno describes walking meditation as just a change in posture where we maintain the same level of mindfulness as when sitting. These meditation instructions were offered on Nov. 23
audio.language: day 2 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Meal Reflection: Mindful Awareness while Eating
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno encourages us to take and to eat the meal with mindful awareness. This meal reflection was offered on Nov. 23
audio.language: day 2 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: The Eight Standards of the Dhamma
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno describes this retreat as a way to simulate the monastic training. In the course of the talk he introduces the “8 Standards of Dhamma” as it was given to Maha Pajapati Gotami and encourages us not to be intimidated by circumstances and to learn how to get out of the way. This talk was offered on Nov. 23
audio.language: day 2 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Walking: Being The One Who Knows
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno encourages us to do walking meditation while “being the one who knows.” These meditation instructions were offered on Nov. 23
audio.language: day 2 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Questions and Answers 1
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno answers questions regarding: 1) dispassion 2) Arahants and anger 3) infidelity 4) dispassion in relationships 5) drifting and pain 6) high beds. This Q & A session was offered on Nov. 23
audio.language: day 2 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa. The full index of questions and answers is available for download here.

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: The Kindest Thing We Can Do For Ourselves
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno talks about various “jhāna factors” giving especial emphasis to the qualities of vitakka and vicara – directed thought and evaluation. Also touched upon is the capacity for developing confidence in our ability to know and let go – “the kindest thing we can do for ourselves.” This talk was offered on Nov. 24
audio.language: day 3 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Walking: There\'s Really No Difference
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno emphasizes the importance of walking meditation explaining that “There\'s really no difference” between one posture and another. These meditation instructions were offered on Nov. 24
audio.language: day 3 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Meal Reflection: Letting Go of Anticipation and Worry
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno gives a meal reflection on knowing and letting go of the common anticipation and worry about food. This meal reflection was offered on Nov. 24
audio.language: day 3 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Giving Attention to the Ordinary
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the five subjects for frequent recollection and the Tibetan four thoughts that turn the mind as ways to induce spiritual urgency. He employs Ajahn Chah\'s similes of life being like a chicken who will eventually go to market or like an ice cube in the sun. This talk was offered on Nov. 24
audio.language: day 3 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Questions and Answers 2
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno answers questions regarding: 1) practitioners and illness 2) sañña
audio.language: sankhara
audio.category: and viññana 3) boredom 4) dependent origination 5) compassion in care giving 6) letting go in “normal” life 7) living in “virtual reality” 8) bodily tension and the breath 9) powerful mind-states 10) having multiple meditation subjects 11) a husband\'s death 12) characteristics 13) dispassion and equanimity 14) pancupadana 15) having an “all hindrance attack.” This Q & A session was offered on Nov. 24
audio.mp3: day 3 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa. The full index of questions and answers is available for download here.

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Pliant
audio.author: Malleable
audio.body: monastic-retreat-2013-pliant-malleable-luminous
audio.category: Ajahn Pasanno emphasizes starving the five hindrances and feeding the seven factors of awakening in order to relinquish the grip of self. This talk was offered on Nov. 25
audio.mp3: day 4 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Meal Reflection: Meal Blessing
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno explains the meal blessing chant and urges us to contemplate and appreciate our food. This meal reflection was offered on Nov. 25
audio.language: day 4 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: There is No Quick
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo reflects upon the importance of truthfulness for long-term practice. We can turn our attention to the long-term benefits of practice and see the “space of goodness” which is always present. This talk was offered on Nov. 25
audio.language: day 4 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Questions and Answers 3
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno answers questions regarding: 1) body scan and Ajahn Chah 2) body and delusion 3) the Pāli canon 4) having a baby 5) the 5 hindrances 6) inadequacy 7) feelings in jhana 8) harmful concentration 9) being bullied 10) mental formations 11) aspiring 12) selfishness 13) the 4 Stages of Enlightenment 14) compassionate seclusion 15) restraint with kids 16) past life karma 17) noting 18) mental formations 19) transgression 20) right intention. This Q & A session was offered on Nov. 25
audio.language: day 4 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa. The full index of questions and answers is available for download here.

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Uncomplicating the Four Noble Truths
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno encourages us to tune in to experiencing the Four Noble Truths which are like the ground floor of a two-story house and a pivot point for seeing things clearly. This talk was offered on Nov. 26
audio.language: day 5 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Meal Reflection: To Allay Dukkha
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno describes the monastic meal reflection: food is eaten not for enjoyment but only to relieve the pain of hunger. This meal reflection was offered on Nov. 26
audio.language: day 5 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Bring to Life the Contemplation of Death
audio.author: Debbie Stamp
audio.body: Debbie Stamp reflects with deep gratitude on her practice of the recollection of death
audio.language: how it has enriched her life
audio.category: and how it helped her to be present for her own mother\'s passing. This talk was offered on Nov. 26
audio.mp3: day 5 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Questions and Answers 4
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno answers questions regarding: 1) in and out breathing 2) dreams 3) an Ajahn Chah quote 4) metta 5) wholesome qualities 6) non-complicated thought 7) relationships 8) obsession 9) dispassion vs. engaging 10) sañña
audio.language: saṅkhara
audio.category: and viññana 11) family 12) fools 13) crying 14) control. This Q & A session was offered on Nov. 26
audio.mp3: day 5 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa. The full index of questions and answers is available for download here.

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Engaging the 16 Steps of Breath Meditation
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: When beginning meditation
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno suggests clarifying our aspiration for happiness to set the mood/tone for our practice. He further expounds upon each of the 16 steps of breath meditation and encourages us to be flexible and experiment with this inexhaustable meditation. This guided meditation was offered on Nov. 27
audio.category: day 6 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Meal Reflection: Element Meditation
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno urges us to reflect on food as merely elements of nature. This meal reflection was offered on Nov. 27
audio.language: day 6 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Tomorrow
audio.author: Who Knows
audio.body: monastic-retreat-2013-tomorrow-who-knows-death-may-come
audio.category: After reflection on community-retreat harmony and the desire to be understood
audio.mp3: Ajahn Ñaniko relates his experience of the unexpected death of a friend in a cave in Thailand and urges heedfulness
audio.status: quoting the sutta “One Excellent Day.” This talk was offered on Nov. 27
audio.user: day 6 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Questions and Answers 5
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Passano answers questions regarding: 1) funerals 2) memory 3) no-self 4) Don\'t Hold Back 5) funerals 6) constancy 7) highest blessings 8) retreat 9) brahmaviharas 10) Ānapānasati 11) pain 12) 32 parts 13) birth/becoming. This Q & A session was offered on Nov. 27
audio.language: day 6 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa. The full index of questions and answers is available for download here.

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Thanksgiving: Gratitude and Balance
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno relates a story of great generosity shown to him as a young monk and goes on to reflect on the importance of balance
audio.language: tuning the factors of the path “just right
audio.category: ” and immediacy of view in order to practice well. This talk was offered on Nov. 28
audio.mp3: day 7 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Meal Reflection: Sharing the Blessings
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno talks a about the importance of “sharing the blessings” of our practice by dedicating our wholesome actions unto others. This meal reflection was offered on Nov. 28
audio.language: day 7 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Deeply Contemplating the Three Characteristics
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo notes how different people tend to resonate most with one of the three characteristics. Whether we\'re “dukkha-people
audio.language: ” “anicca-people
audio.mp3: ” when any one characteristic is penetrated
audio.status: all three become apparent. This talk was offered on Nov. 28
audio.user: day 7 of the 2013 Thanksgiving Abhayagiri Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Questions and Answers 6
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Passano answers questions regarding: 1) Ajahn Chah 2) challenge 3) breath 4) standing 5) chanting 6) mind vs. heart 7) metta 8) Ajahn Karuṇadhammo 9) appreciation 10) Ajahn Lee 11) Four ways of answering questions 12) Saṅgha chant 13) aversion 14) pārami 15) suicide 16) chanting book 18) organ donation 19) out of breath 20) formal practice This Q & A session was offered on Nov. 28
audio.language: day 7 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa. The full index of questions and answers is available for download here.

audio.title: Upasika Day: Mangala Sutta
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo explains the last five verses of the Mangala\r\nSutta
audio.language: and the monks and upasikas recite the sutta together. This\r\ntalk was offered on the December 7

audio.title: What it Means to Cultivate the Way
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: Ajahn Ñaniko reviews a number of Dhamma themes and invites the\r\ncommunity to review their practice before the upcoming Winter\r\nRetreat. This talk was offered on December 10

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Its Up to Us to Experiment
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno encourages us to use the practices of tranquility and insight to nurture a “stillness within conditions” and to cultivate an “inner witness” which reflects on the anicca
audio.language: dukkha
audio.category: and anatta aspects of all things. In this way
audio.mp3: our path will develop incrementally until reaching a fundamental shift in experience. This talk was offered on Nov. 29
audio.status: day 8 of the 2013 Abhayagiri Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat at the Angela Center in Santa Rosa.\r\n

audio.title: Monastic Retreat 2013: Remembering to Remember
audio.author: Debbie Stamp
audio.body: Debbie Stamp speaks about the importance of continually evaluating the validity of our assumptions about people
audio.language: places
