audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><span style=\"font-style: normal\">Visiting\r\nfrom Amaravatti Monastery in England
audio.category: Ajahn Ahimsako shares the\r\nunique approach of Ajaan Dune to th
audio.mp3: serif\">e
audio.status: serif\">\r\n
audio.user: serif\">core\r\n
audio.youtube_id: serif\">teaching\r\n

audio.title: Upasika Day: The Four Major Pilgrimage Sites
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: The Mahaparinibbana Sutta describes the benefits of pilgrimage to the places where the Buddha was born (Lumbini)
audio.language: awakened (Bodh Gaya)
audio.mp3: and attained parinibbana (Kusinara). This\r\nteaching was offered during the April 25

audio.title: Upasika Day: Slideshow of the Pilgrimage Sites
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body:
Ajahn
Karuṇadhammo presents a series of photographs of the major
pilgrimage sites and describes how these sites have changed over
time. This teaching was offered during the April 25
audio.language: 2015 Upasika\r\nDay.

audio.title: Upasika Day: Questions and Answers about Pilgrimage
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
The
teachers respond to the questions generated by the previous two
presentations. This
teaching was offered during the April 25
audio.language: 2015 Upasika Day.

audio.title: Upasika Day: Tudong Pilgrimage in Thailand
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
Ajahn
Pasanno describes wandering
through the Thai jungle
as spiritual practice. This
teaching was offered during the April 25
audio.language: 2015 Upasika Day.

audio.title: Upasika Day: Tudong in the United States
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body:
Ajahn
Ñaniko reflects on his two recent wandering pilgrimages in
California. This
teaching was offered during the April 25
audio.language: 2015 Upasika Day.

audio.title: The Beauty of a Well-Trained Heart
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Reflecting on Ajahn Chah\'s frequent reminder that “everything is teaching us
audio.language: ” Ajahn Pasanno contemplates the value of the external aspects of practice. He balances this with an encouragement to let go of attachments to external beauty and instead aspire to the internal beauty of a well-trained heart. This talk was offered on May 9

audio.title: Solitude in the Body
audio.author: Ajahn Ñaniko
audio.body: One way to cultivate seclusion is to spend time alone at your dwelling
audio.language: but in this talk
audio.category: Ajahn Ñaniko recollects Ajahn Liem\'s approach to bodily seclusion as always inhabiting the body even when engaged in activity. He goes on to discuss the benefits of mindfulness of the body
audio.status: and taking refuge in the wholesome. This talk was offered on May 10

audio.title: Truth
audio.author: Ajahn Karunadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo offers reflections on truth (sacca) from a Buddhist perspective – from the basic level of honesty in speech to the sublime level of realizing transcendent spiritual truths. This talk was offered on May 16
audio.language: 2015 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Just Enough
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: After returning from a seven-day walk along the California coast with Tan Thanavaro
audio.language: Ajahn Jotipālo tells three stories from the tudong and reflects on relying only on what you carry on your back and receive from the generosity of others. This talk was offered on May 17

audio.title: Lizard Mind
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Stubby the Fence Lizard owns the near end of Ajahn Karuṇadhammo\'s walking path. Stubby recently lost half his tail defending his territory from Ajahn Karuṇadhammo\'s efforts not to accidentally squash him during walking meditation. Humans share these basic possessive and aggressive impulses
audio.language: but they are moderated by our reflective capacities. Ajahn Karuṇadhammo goes on to reflect upon the Fire Sermon (SN 35.28) and Ajahn Chah\'s last letter to Ajahn Sumedho.

audio.title: The Balm of Loving-Kindness
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Ajahn Jotipālo reflects on the power of mettā (loving-kindness)
audio.language: to act as a healing balm for the heart. He shares some of his personal methods of doing loving-kindness practice and also offers insights into how one can practice with the other three brahmavihāras – karunā (compassion)
audio.mp3: and upekkhā (equanimity). This talk was offered on May 30

audio.title: Mara\'s Armies
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: On the occasion of Visakha Puja (celebrating the birth
audio.language: enlightenment
audio.mp3: Ajahn Pasanno recounts the Buddha\'s reproach to Mara under Bodhi Tree: the Buddha named Mara\'s ten armies and declared his willingness to die rather than succumb to them (Sn 3.2). Ajahn Pasanno goes on to describe the armies in detail and how we too can practice fearlessness in the face of such challenges. This talk was offered on Visakha Puja

audio.title: Abhayagiri 2015 Winter Retreat
audio.author: Abhayagiri Sangha
audio.body: This 675 MB zip file contains all the readings and reflections from the Abhayagiri 2015 Winter Retreat which focused on the four foundations of mindfulness. After several introductory talks by Ajahn Pasanno
audio.language: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo describes the Pali Canon\'s teachings about mindfulness of the body. Of particular interest are two narrated slide shows explaining the contemplation of the thirty-two parts of the body. The remainder of the retreat focuses on readings from three chapters in Ajahn Ṭhānissaro\'s book Right Mindfulness. You can request a free distribution CD of the retreat on the books page. The CD contents are also available for online browsing (opens in new tab).

audio.title: Puñña and Kusala
audio.author: Ajahn Ñaniko
audio.body: Puñña
audio.language: usually translated as merit
audio.category: is not just about making a material offering to get a good result in return
audio.mp3: Ajahn Ñāniko tells us. It is a cultivation of kusala – skillfulness
audio.status: wholesomeness. He teaches that working with the ten pāramīs – spiritual perfections – we can create a skillful and wholesome environment
audio.youtube_id: for achieving the greater aspiration of awakening. This talk was offered on June 6

audio.title: Failing in a Good Way
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: During a brief visit to Abhayagiri
audio.language: Ajahn Amaro exhorts the newly ordained bhikkhus Tan Khantiko and Tan Gambhīro and novices Sāmaṇera Kondañño and Sāmaṇera Jāgaro on the significance of the holy life. He speaks about the value of practicing in community and the internal meaning of Buddha
audio.mp3: and Sangha. He chuckles at the American obsession with success and asserts “it\'s really important to learn how to fail well
audio.status: ” learning from our mistakes rather than making excuses for ourselves or wallow ing in regret. This talk was offered on June 9

audio.title: Breath Meditation: No One Is Keeping Score
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro begins the session with meditation instructions emphasizing mindfulness of body and breath. This guided meditation was offered on June 10
audio.language: 2015 at Yoga Mendocino in Ukiah

audio.title: Thirsty?
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Beginning with the theme of the long California drought
audio.language: Ajahn Amaro observes that tanha
audio.status: literally means thirst in Pali. He reflects on how distinguishing between unpleasant feeling (“I don\'t like it”) and aversion (“I can\'t stand it”) allows one to dodge the second arrow of mental suffering. Maintaining awareness of emotional discomfort without slipping into reactivity can allow us to act and speak in ways that are in tune with what can be done to mitigate the effects of the drought. This talk was offered on June 10

audio.title: Q & A: Our Response to Suffering
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: Ajahn Amaro answers questions regarding responding to suffering in the world
audio.language: calming the scattered mind
audio.mp3: and working with a difficult family situation. This question and answer session occured on June 10

audio.title: Cultivating Desire
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: The Buddha taught that desire is the cause of suffering and relinquishing desire brings about the cessation of suffering. This can lead to a misconception that Buddhist practitioners seek to rid themselves of all desires. Ajahn Pasanno teaches that this is a misunderstanding of the nuances of desire. In fact
audio.language: cultivating skillful desires is an important part of the Buddha\'s path. This talk was offered on June 13

audio.title: The Meaning of Protective Chants
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Chanting blessings (paritta chanting) is a regular feature of Buddhist monastic life. Ajahn Jotipālo reflects upon this practice
audio.language: telling several stories and emphasizing the power of truth. This talk was offered on June 17

audio.title: Desire or Aspiration SRMC Daylong: Balancing and Brightening
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Beginning the day with a guided meditation
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno describes how to use in and out breathing to settle and brighten the body and mind. This guided meditation was offered on the daylong retreat “Desire or Aspiration: Can a Buddhist Want Anything?” at Spirit Rock Mediation Center on June 14

audio.title: Desire or Aspiration SRMC Daylong: Two Kinds of Desire
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: In the first talk of the day
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno differentiates between skillful and unskillful desire
audio.category: distinguishing between two Pali words that are translated as desire: taṇhā
audio.mp3: which is a cause of suffering
audio.user: which is one of the Four Bases of Success. The Bhujima Sutta (MN 126) states that the success of one\'s spiritual endeavor depends on skillfully directed effort rather than wishing for realization. This talk was offered on the daylong retreat “Desire or Aspiration: Can a Buddhist Want Anything?” at Spirit Rock Mediation Center on June 14

audio.title: Desire or Aspiration SRMC Daylong: Listening to Desire
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: The second meditation period emphasizes listening to the mind
audio.language: listening to desire. This guided meditation was offered on the daylong retreat “Desire or Aspiration: Can a Buddhist Want Anything?” at Spirit Rock Mediation Center on June 14

audio.title: Desire or Aspiration SRMC Daylong: Questions and Answers 1
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: In the first question and answer session
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno responds to questions regarding the Bodhisatta\'s motivation for going forth
audio.youtube_id: and whether sexuality is a negative desire. This question and answer session occurred on the daylong retreat “Desire or Aspiration: Can a Buddhist Want Anything?” at Spirit Rock Mediation Center on June 14

audio.title: Desire or Aspiration SRMC Daylong: Knowing and Letting Go
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Chah summarized the path of practice as “knowing and letting go.” Ajahn Pasanno leads a brief meditation on this theme. This guided meditation was offered on the daylong retreat “Desire or Aspiration: Can a Buddhist Want Anything?” at Spirit Rock Mediation Center on June 14

audio.title: Desire or Aspiration SRMC Daylong: Cultivating Contentment
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Contentment is the alternative to desire. Ajahn Pasanno speaks about contentment with the requisites of clothing
audio.language: food
audio.category: and shelter. He then explains why desire is needed to realize the cessation of desire (SN 51.15). This talk was offered on the daylong retreat “Desire or Aspiration: Can a Buddhist Want Anything?” at Spirit Rock Mediation Center on June 14

audio.title: Desire or Aspiration SRMC Daylong: Questions and Answers 2
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: In the second question and answer session
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno responds to questions regarding sleepiness during retreats
audio.status: and the meaning of anatta. This question and answer session occurred on the daylong retreat “Desire or Aspiration: Can a Buddhist Want Anything?” at Spirit Rock Mediation Center on June 14

audio.title: Painfully Delicious
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: In honor of Ajahn Chah\'s birthday celebration
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno shares some recollections of his teacher. Focusing on Ajahn Chah\'s straightforward day-to-day approach to learning and training
audio.category: the stories revolve around nibbidā. Usually translated as disenchantment with worldly things
audio.mp3: nibbidā is a positive mental quality that Ajahn Chah likened to eating spicy food that burns going down but is deeply satisfying to eat. This talk was offered on June 20

audio.title: Not-Self: Don\'t Pick Up the Phone
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: After the Upāsikā Day focusing on the Buddha\'s teachings on anattā
audio.language: “not-self
audio.category: ” Ajahn Pasanno offers a reflection on the true simplicity of this often misunderstood concept. He uses sutta stories
audio.status: and practical metaphors to give us an insight into this essential teaching unique to Buddhism. This talk was offered on June 27

audio.title: Korwat: Monastic Etiquette
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: With senior Thai Ajahns and lay guests arriving for a visit to Abhayagiri in two days
audio.language: Ajahn Jotipālo reads and gives commentaries on several passages from the manual Korwat: Monastic Etiquette at Wat Pah Nanchat by Ajahn Chandako. This talk was offered on July 4

audio.title: The Great Treasure of a Human Birth
audio.author: Ajahn Liem
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">Translated\r\nby Ajahn Thāniyo
audio.category: Ajahn Liem gives instruction on how we can take full advantage of the great treasure of this human birth. He offers first three guiding principles for training one's own heart: moral conduct
audio.status: and right effort. He then teaches the four wholesome dhammas for living in society fearlessly: truthfulness

audio.title: เป็นมนุษย์สุดแสนดีมีโอกาส (ภาษาไทย)
audio.author: Ajahn Liem
audio.body: <font size=\"4\">หลวงพ่อเลี่ยมได้อธิบายว่าการได้เกิดเป็นมนุษย์คือสมบัติอันล้ำค่าที่สุด พร้อมทั้งให้คำแนะนำเกี่ยวกับการใช้สมบัตินี้ให้เกิดประโยชน์สูงสุด ท่านได้อธิบายหลักพื้นฐานในการฝึกจิต 3 ประการ คือ ศีลสังวรณ์
audio.language: ความสำรวม
audio.category: \r\nและสัมมาวายามะ นอกจากนี้หลวงพ่อเลี่ยมยังได้สอนเรื่องหลักธรรมในการอยู่ร่วมกัน 4 ประการ คือ สัจจะ
audio.user: และจาคะ หลวงพ่อเลี่ยมได้แสดงพระธรรมเทศนานี้ในวันที่ 11 กรกฎาคม ค.ศ. 2015 ในศาลาเอนกประสงค์หลังใหม่ที่ยังอยู่ในระหว่างการก่อสร้าง ณ วัดป่าอภัยคีรี และได้รับการแปลเป็นภาษาอังกฤษโดยพระอาจารย์ฐานิโย</font>

audio.title: The Textbook of Body and Mind
audio.author: Ajahn Jundee
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif">Ajahn Jundee describes how Ajahn Chah taught local villagers using similes from nature rather than scholastic terminology and emphasizes that all true knowledge originates from knowing the body and mind. This talk was offered on July 8
audio.category: 2015 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery and was translated by Ajahn Thāniyo.

audio.title: ตำราเรียนเรื่องกายและใจ (ภาษาไทย)
audio.author: Ajahn Jundee
audio.body:
พระอาจารย์จันดีอธิบายว่า หลวงปู่ชาสอนชาวบ้านโดยไม่ใช้คำศัพท์ทางวิชาการ หากแต่ยกตัวอย่างจากสิ่งรอบตัวที่มีอยู่ตามธรรมชาติ 
พระอาจารย์จันดีได้เน้นว่าความรู้แจ้งที่แท้จริงนั้นเกิดจากการรู้กายรู้ใจของตน พระอาจารย์จันดีแสดงพระธรรมเทศนานี้ในวันที่ 8 กรกฎาคม ค.ศ. 2015 ณ 
วัดป่าอภัยคีรี และได้รับการแปลเป็นภาษาอังกฤษโดยพระอาจารย์ฐานิโย
audio.language: Thai

audio.title: Worldly Winds (Thai/English)
audio.author: Ajahn Liem
audio.body: In response to a teatime question about dealing with social anxiety and fear of failure
audio.language: Ajahn Liem urges us to remain at the point of balance in regards to praise and blame
audio.category: contemplating our experience in terms of nature rather than self-view. This talk was offered on July 7
audio.mp3: 2015 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery and was translated by Ajahn Pasanno.

audio.title: Recollecting the Buddha
audio.author: Ajahn Liem
audio.body: Before the meal in the partially-built Reception Hall
audio.language: Ajahn Liem recollects that the Buddha was enlightened by understanding nature and exhorts us to do the same. This meal blessing was offered on July 11
audio.category: 2015 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery and was translated by Ajahn Thāniyo.\r\n\r\n

audio.title: Chanting for the Reception Hall
audio.author: Ajahn Liem
audio.body: Ajahn Liem leads the visiting Thai elders and the Abhayagiri Sangha in chanting parittas (auspicious blessing chants) for the new Reception Hall. The recording begins with Ajahn Jundee calling the devas. This chanting was recorded on July 11
audio.language: 2015 at Abhayagiri Monastery.

audio.title: พุทธานุสติ (ภาษาไทย)
audio.author: Ajahn Liem
audio.body: ก่อนเวลาภัตตาหารเพลในศาลาเอนกประสงค์หลังใหม่ที่ยังอยู่ในระหว่างการก่อสร้าง หลวงพ่อเลี่ยมได้ให้ข้อคิดว่า พระพุทธเจ้าได้ทรงตรัสรู้โดยการเข้าใจธรรมชาติ \r\nและได้แนะนำให้พวกเราทำตามอย่าง หลวงพ่อเลี่ยมได้ให้ข้อคิดนี้ในวันที่ 11 กรกฎาคม ค.ศ. 2015 ณ วัดป่าอภัยคีรี และได้รับการแปลเป็นภาษาอังกฤษโดยพระอาจารย์ฐานิโย
audio.language: Thai

audio.title: การเจริญพระพุทธมนต์เพื่อศาลาเอนกประสงค์หลังใหม่ (ภาษาไทย)
audio.author: Ajahn Liem
audio.body: หลวงพ่อเลี่ยมได้นำคณะพระเถระอาคันตุกะ พร้อมทั้งคณะสงฆ์วัดป่าอภัยคีรี สวดพระปริตรเพื่อความเป็นสิริมงคลแก่ศาลาเอนกประสงค์หลังใหม่ โดยเริ่มจากพระอาจารย์จันดีสวดมนต์บทชุมนุมเทวดา คณะสงฆ์ได้เจริญพระพุทธมนต์นี้ในวันที่ 11 กรกฎาคม ค.ศ. 2015 ณ วัดป่าอภัยคีรี
audio.language: Thai

audio.title: The Society of the Family
audio.author: Ajahn Liem
audio.body: To develop a sense of stability in the midst of family life
audio.language: Ajahn Liem urges a young couple to develop honesty
audio.status: and sacrifice. This meal blessing was given at the home of Abhayagiri lay supporters in Sonoma County on July 9
audio.user: 2015 and was translated by Ajahn Thāniyo.\r\n

audio.title: สังคมครอบครัว (ภาษาไทย)
audio.author: Ajahn Liem
audio.body: ในระหว่างกิจนิมนต์เพื่อไปฉันภัตตาหารเพลที่บ้านของอุบาสก-อุบาสิกาผู้เป็นศิษย์วัดป่าอภัยคีรี หลวงพ่อเลี่ยมได้สอนให้สามีภรรยามีความซื่อสัตย์ต่อกัน (สัจจะ)
audio.language: ความข่มใจ \r\n(ทมะ)
audio.category: ความอดทน (ขันติ)
audio.mp3: และความเสียสละ (จาคะ) หลวงพ่อเลี่ยมได้ให้ข้อคิดนี้ที่บ้านหลังดังกล่าวซึ่งอยู่ในเขตโซโนมา ในวันที่ 9 กรกฎาคม ค.ศ. 2015 และได้รับการแปลเป็นภาษาอังกฤษโดยพระอาจารย์ฐานิโย

audio.title: Harmony of Body and Mind
audio.author: Ajahn Liem
audio.body: Beginning with a Thai poem telling the story of how Eye and Foot fought about who was superior
audio.language: Ajahn Liem reflects on many elements of the Buddhist path including material offerings
audio.mp3: contemplating the nature of the body
audio.status: and refraining from unwholesome actions. This talk was offered on July 12
audio.user: 2015 at Wat Buddhanusorn and was translated by Ajahn Thāniyo.

audio.title: ความสามัคคีของกายและใจ (ภาษาไทย)
audio.author: Ajahn Liem
audio.body: <font size=\"4\">หลวงพ่อเลี่ยมเริ่มต้นพระธรรมเทศนากัณฑ์นี้ด้วยบทกลอนที่เล่าถึงดวงตาและเท้าของมนุษย์ที่ถกเถียงกันว่าใครจะยิ่งใหญ่กว่ากัน \r\nจากนั้นหลวงพ่อเลี่ยมได้อธิบายถึงองค์ธรรมต่างๆในพระพุทธศาสนา อาทิ ทานมัย
audio.language: อภัยทาน
audio.category: ธรรมชาติของกาย
audio.mp3: และการละอกุศลทั้งปวง หลวงพ่อเลี่ยมได้แสดงพระธรรมเทศนานี้ในวันที่ 12 กรกฎาคม ค.ศ. 2015 ณ วัดพุทธานุสรณ์ และได้รับการแปลเป็นภาษาอังกฤษโดยพระอาจารย์ฐานิโย</font>

audio.title: โลกธรรม (ภาษาไทยและภาษาอังกฤษ)
audio.author: Ajahn Liem
audio.body: ในช่วงฉันน้ำปานะ ได้มีผู้ถามคำถามเกี่ยวกับความวิตกกังวลที่เขามีเมื่ออยู่ในสังคม และความกลัวว่าจะล้มเหลว หลวงพ่อเลี่ยมตอบคำถามนี้โดยกระตุ้นให้เราวางใจเป็นกลางทั้งกับคำสรรเสริญและคำนินทา \r\nและให้มองประสบการณ์นี้ในลักษณะของสิ่งต่างๆที่เกิดขึ้นตามธรรมชาติเท่านั้น แทนที่จะมองว่าเป็นตัวเราหรือของเรา หลวงพ่อเลี่ยมได้ให้ข้อคิดนี้ในวันที่ 7 กรกฎาคม ค.ศ. 2015 ณ วัดป่าอภัยคีรี \r\nและได้รับการแปลเป็นภาษาอังกฤษโดยพระอาจารย์ปสันโน
audio.language: Thai

audio.title: Awakening to the Ordinary
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">Reflecting\r\non Ajahn Liem\'s recent visit
audio.category: Ajahn Pasanno contemplates a common theme he found in the venerable master's teachings to the community – that of the importance of the ordinary in our practice. Among the examples Ajahn Pasanno gives are the “worldly dhammas” - mental states of praise and blame
audio.user: happiness and suffering. He teaches that while these ordinary patterns of human nature bring about great dissatisfaction in our lives
audio.youtube_id: it is the observation of them that can bring about our awakening. This talk was offered on July 18

audio.title: Four Protective Meditations
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: Amidst various Dhamma themes
audio.language: Ajahn Ñaniko describes four classical protective meditations: recollecting the Buddha
audio.mp3: contemplating the unattractive nature of the body (asubha)
audio.status: and recollecting death (maraṇassati). This talk was offered on July 23

audio.title: The Rhythm of the Breath
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif">Ajahn Pasanno teaches how the skillful practice of mindfulness of breathing fulfills the seven factors of awakening. He discusses what is needed (and what is not) to practice mindfulness of breathing skillfully
audio.category: and delineates the\r\nseven factors of awakening in a practical
audio.mp3: down-to-earth way. This talk was offered on July 25

audio.title: Upasika Day: The Middle Way of Not-Self
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Anatta (not-self) is a central but often misunderstood theme of the Buddha\'s teaching. Ajahn Pasanno reads and explains two suttas on this topic: the Maha-Rahululovada Sutta (MN 62) and AN 4.178. Questions: (27:26) What are the commentaries? (31:20) What is consciousness? (33:46) How should we relate to not-self? (38:46) When you watch your defilements and they don\'t go away
audio.language: what do you do? (40:59) Why go through all the trouble to teach us not to have a self and then refuse to tell us there is no self? (44:29) Is renting a good metaphor for not-self? (53:47) How do we face our fear regarding cessation of self-identity? This reading and discussion occurred on the June 27
audio.category: 2015 Upasika Day at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.\r\n

audio.title: Upasika Day: The Purpose of Not-Self
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Rather than expounding a metaphysical doctrine of not-self
audio.language: the Buddha demonstrates the selfless nature of the five aggregates on the grounds that they are not subject to complete volitional control. Ajahn Pasanno illustrates this with readings from the Culasaccaka Sutta (MN 35)
audio.mp3: and the Culasihananda Sutta (MN 11). This reading and discussion occurred on the June 27
audio.status: 2015 Upasika Day at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.\r\n

audio.title: Upasika Day: Not-Self Contemplative Reading
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: The Upasika Day ends with a contemplative reading of the Anattalakkhana Sutta (SN 22:59
audio.language: p. 52 in the Abhayagiri Chanting Book) and the sharing of merit chant. This contemplative reading occurred on the June 27
audio.category: 2015 Upasika Day at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.\r\n

audio.title: The World Is Not a Place of Suffering
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><span style=\"font-style: normal\"><span style=\"font-weight: normal\">As\r\nthe Vassa period begins
audio.category: marked by the Asalha Puja two nights earlier\r\nwhich celebrated the date of the Buddha\'s first discourse
audio.status: serif\">\r\n
audio.user: serif\">Ajahn\r\n
audio.youtube_id: serif\">Pasanno

audio.title: What is Practice?
audio.author: Joseph Kappel
audio.body: Reflecting on his many years training under Ajahn Chah and twenty years as a bhikkhu (Ajahn Pabbakaro
audio.category: Joseph Kappel recollects themes of faith
audio.user: and the importance of the five precepts. This talk was offered on July 25
audio.youtube_id: 2015 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery on the occasion of Asāhḷā Pūjā.\r\n

audio.title: Being the One Who Knows
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: On the night of Asāhḷā Pūjā
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno gives breath meditation instructions emphasizing Buddho
audio.category: “being the one who knows.” This guided meditation was offered on July 25

audio.title: Chariots to Freedom
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo reflects on the choice between a worldly profession of right livelihood
audio.language:
and going forth as a samaṇa as Anāgārika
Armand did the night before. Ajahn reminds us that whether one is a lay practitioner or a monastic
we must keep what is truly important at the center of our lives –
these teachings that point us in the direction of freedom. He then
recounts a simile from the suttas to emphasize that while the
practices of generosity
audio.mp3: and meditation are all necessary\r\n“chariots” to reach that goal
audio.status: they are not the goal in and of\r\nthemselves. This talk was offered on August 8

audio.title: Knower of the Worlds
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif\">One\r\nof the recollections of the Buddha chanted at the monastery nearly\r\nevery day is that of
audio.category: serif\">lokavidu
audio.mp3: serif\">\r\n– the quality of his being a “knower of the world
audio.status: serif\">s
audio.user: serif\">.”\r\nBut what exactly does that mean? Ajahn Pasano
audio.youtube_id: serif\">defines\r\nthe term and

audio.title: How Do I Live This Training?
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif\">On\r\nth
audio.category: serif\">is
audio.mp3: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><span style=\"font-style: normal\"><span style=\"font-weight: normal\">\r\nfirst Wan Phra of August
audio.status: lay resident Armand takes on the white robe\r\nof the

audio.title: Firestarting
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\">Ajahn\r\nJotipālo contemplates the value of devotional practices and\r\nexplores some practical uses of them
audio.category: all in the context of a\r\nmetaphor about the range of ways to start a fire. This talk was\r\noffered on August 15

audio.title: Upasika Day: Buddhist Identity
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: After introducing the topic of Buddhist identity in the modern world
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno leads a discussion around this theme. This discussion occurred on the August 16
audio.category: 2015 Upasika Day at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Gratitude for Water
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: In contemplating the importance of water in our lives
audio.language: Ajahn Ñaniko reflects on gratitude as the root of our wholesome qualities. He stresses that since one\'s own views are really the only thing one can change
audio.category: the practice of gratitude can be foundational
audio.mp3: especially in our relationships with others. This talk was offered on August 22

audio.title: MCC Abhayagiri Benefit Event: Practicing Together in the City
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: To begin the Abhayagiri Benefit and Community Event
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno reflects upon the significance of practicing together with monks from the forest. This talk was given on August 23
audio.category: 2015 at the Mindfulness Care Center in San Francisco.\r\n

audio.title: MCC Abhayagiri Benefit Event: Chanting
audio.author: Abhayagiri Sangha
audio.body: Continuing the Abhayagiri Benefit and Community Event
audio.language: the community chants the Morning Chanting and the Buddha\'s Words on Lovingkindness. The text of the chanting can be found in the Abhayagiri Chanting Book. This chanting occurred on August 23
audio.category: 2015 at the Mindfulness Care Center in San Francisco.

audio.title: MCC Abhayagiri Benefit Event: Reflecting on the Refuges
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno gives meditation instructions contemplating the Buddha
audio.language: Dhamma and Sangha as qualities of the heart. These meditation instructions were given on the August 23
audio.category: 2015 Abhayagiri Benefit and Community Event at the Mindfulness Care Center in San Francisco.

audio.title: MCC Abhayagiri Benefit Event: Drawing Close
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: The interdependence of the monastic and lay Buddhist communities reflects the lack of separation between the transcendent and “the real world.” Ajahn Pasanno goes on to explain the structure of the Buddha\'s path. This talk was offered on the August 23
audio.language: 2015 Abhayagiri Benefit and Community Event at the Mindfulness Care Center in San Francisco.

audio.title: Dukkha for Teens
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">With\r\na group of teens visiting the monastery on a weekend retreat
audio.category: Ajahn Pasanno explains the Buddha's reasoning behind having the lay community periodically take eight precepts for “a day and a night.” He then gives a clear
audio.user: and the types of dukkha
audio.youtube_id: and on the practical ways the Four Noble Truths can liberate us from it. This talk was offered on August 29

audio.title: The Visitors
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: <em>“<font face=\"Times New Roman
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><span style=\"font-style: normal\"><span style=\"font-weight: normal\">Enlightenment\r\nis an accident
audio.category: but some activities make you accident-prone.”\r\n
audio.mp3: serif\">~Krishnamurti. \r\n
audio.status: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><span style=\"font-style: normal\"><span style=\"font-weight: normal\">Beginning\r\nby reflecting on this quote
audio.user: Ajahn Pasanno teaches that the true\r\nnature of the mind is to be luminous
audio.youtube_id: but that it is stained by\r\ndefilements.

audio.title: Hiking and Meditation
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: \r\n\r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\">Taking\r\noff from Ajahn Pasanno\'s talk the night before
audio.category:
Ajahn Jotipālo
contemplates how the mind reacts when accidents happen. This leads
into some personal recollections of incidents in nature and how
mindfulness can make a difference when difficult situations occur. He
then shares how he has been exploring ways to combine hiking and
meditation as he prepares for a camping retreat with a group of monks
at Yosemite Park. This talk was offered on September 6

audio.title: Lifting Up and Tuning In
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: <em><font face=\"Times New Roman
audio.language: serif\">T
audio.category: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><span style=\"font-style: normal\"><span style=\"font-weight: normal\">aking\r\nrefuge in the Buddha
audio.user: serif\">\r\n
audio.youtube_id: serif\">is\r\nmore than symb

audio.title: Dhamma Front and Center
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: Drawing on the qualities of the Dhamma outlined in the Gotami Sutta (AN 8.53)
audio.language: Ajahn Ñaniko urges us to practice Dhamma in accordance with the Dhamma rather than according to our preferences. This talk was offered on September 20

audio.title: The Peace of the Way Things Are
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: <font face=\"Times New Roman
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\"><span style=\"font-weight: normal\">From\r\nthe perspective of Dhamma
audio.mp3: life offers us a choice between an existence of agitation and confusion or one of wisdom and peace. The former arises from wanting things to be how we'd like them; the latter is founded on a deep understanding of the way things actually are. This talk was offered on September 26

audio.title: Contentement and Gratitude
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: “Contentment and Gratitude” was the theme of the 2015 Buddhist Bicycle Pilgrimage
audio.language: and Ajahn Pasanno reflects upon these themes the evening after receiving the cyclists. This talk was offered on September 27

audio.title: The Spiritual Faculties in Practice
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: <font face=\"Times New Roman
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\"><span style=\"font-weight: normal\">Ajahn\r\nPasanno reflects on the five spiritual faculties – faith
audio.user: and wisdom – beyond the standard\r\ndefinitions of each. He encourages us to explore each one on a deeper\r\nand more personal level
audio.youtube_id: as tools to cease clinging to the things that bring us suffering. This talk was offered on October 3

audio.title: Kamma SRMC Daylong: Structure of the Day
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo introduces the Abhayagiri monastics
audio.language: the topic of kamma
audio.category: and the structure for the daylong. This talk began the daylong retreat “Karma – Out of Our Control?” at Spirit Rock Mediation Center on September 6

audio.title: Kamma SRMC Daylong: The Presence of the Body
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Since the topic of kamma often inspires heady thinking
audio.language: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo begins the day with meditation instructions bringing attention back to the body. This guided meditation was offered on the daylong retreat “Karma – Out of Our Control?” at Spirit Rock Mediation Center on September 6

audio.title: Kamma SRMC Daylong: Action is Effective (with Q & A)
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo explains the role of kamma in the Buddha\'s teachings in contrast to both ancient and modern views on the topic. His talk is followed by a series of questions concerning random kamma
audio.language: the role of intention
audio.youtube_id: and how can I own kamma if there is no self? This talk was offered on the daylong retreat “Karma – Out of Our Control?” at Spirit Rock Mediation Center on September 6

audio.title: Kamma SRMC Daylong: This-That Conditionality
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: The principle of this-that conditionality describes how both past actions and present attitudes shape suffering and happiness in the present moment. Drawing on Ajahn Ṭhanissaro\'s explanation in The Wings to Awakening
audio.language: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo describes how understanding this-that conditionality can lead to the end of kamma. This talk was offered on the daylong retreat “Karma – Out of Our Control?” at Spirit Rock Mediation Center on September 6

audio.title: Kamma SRMC Daylong: Reflecting on Kamma
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo encourages us to brighten the mind and bring up gratitude by reflecting on the past skillful actions of ourselves and others that led to the opportunity to hear the teachings. This guided meditation was offered on the daylong retreat “Karma – Out of Our Control?” at Spirit Rock Mediation Center on September 6

audio.title: Kamma SRMC Daylong: Questions and Answers
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo responds to questions about kamma and external events
audio.language: kamma\'s influence on rebirth situations
audio.category: how to maintain a sense of urgency regarding the dangers of rebirth without massive anxiety
audio.status: choosing between the lesser of two evils

audio.title: Kamma SRMC Daylong: Skillful Fabrication and Beyond (with Q & A)
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo explains that the path to the end of dukkha involves both fabricating the skills of wholesome intention and wise attention and in investigating the characteristics of all fabrications as impermanent
audio.language: unsatisfactory
audio.category: and not-self. When practiced to completion
audio.mp3: this path leads to the ending of kamma and becoming. Several questions regarding the scope of practice with kamma follow the talk. This talk was offered on the daylong retreat “Karma – Out of Our Control?” at Spirit Rock Mediation Center on September 6

audio.title: Voidness and Awakening
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: Reflecting on two aspects of Ajahn Pasanno\'s Saturday talk
audio.language: Ajahn Jotipālo discusses the sequential nature of the Seven Enlightenment Factors and Ajahn Puṇṇadhammo\'s guided meditation based on the Shorter Discourse on Emptiness (MN 121). This talk was offered on October 5

audio.title: Attending to our Meditation
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.language: serif\"><font size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\"><span style=\"font-weight: normal\">Following\r\nan afternoon reflecting on Jhāna
audio.category: Ajahn Pasanno offers guidance and advice for developing meditation. He encourages us to use attention and encouragement to uplift the mind onto the meditation object and to use appropriate reflection and investigation as a guide. This talk was offered on October 10

audio.title: I Am of the Nature to Age
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: As the world and our lives are swiftly passing
audio.language: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo offers a reflection on the nature of aging and the final stages of life. He explores several themes
audio.status: as well weaving together Dhamma teachings on the five khandas and non-clinging. This talk was offered on October 12

audio.title: Elemental Dhamma
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: <font face=\"Times New Roman
audio.language: serif">Essential to the Dhamma are three aspects: the study of the doctrine (pariyatti)
audio.category: \r\nthe practice of the knowledge acquired (patipati)
audio.mp3: and the absorption and realization of the truth (pativedha). Ajahn Ñaniko reflects on the levels of the path one can achieve – from having a mindful cup of tea to complete liberation
audio.status: and then teaches how contemplation\r\nof the four elements – earth

audio.title: Sewing and Sila
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: <font face=\"Times New Roman
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\"><span style=\"font-weight: normal\">After\r\na sometimes stressful day in which the monastery received delivery of its\r\nbeautiful sandstone Buddha rupa for the new meditation hall
audio.category: Ajahn Jotipālo reflects on the benefits of sila – the intention to live in a moral way – when living and working in community. He uses as an example the work of monks coming together to sew a robe from cloth to be donated at the upcoming Kathina
audio.mp3: and offers the encouragement of an Ajahn Chah teaching: When we have the intention to be peaceful but things that are contrary come up in the mind
audio.status: this is where wisdom can arise. This talk was offered on October 20

audio.title: Getting Stung Feeding the Hunger
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo reflects on nature of perception and the distortions of perception (saññāvipallāsa). Our norm is to operate under unhelpful
audio.language: conditioned patterns for sense gratification
audio.category: for propping\r\nup the sense of self
audio.mp3: for a bit of temporary happiness
audio.status: but never\r\nquite feeling satisfied. This reflections covers a number of dhammas\r\nincluding food

audio.title: Pavarana Day 2015 Community Talks
audio.author: Abhayagiri Sangha
audio.body:
Pavarana
Day is the final day of the 3–month Vassa retreat period. To
celebrate the completion of this period of intensive community
practice and vinaya study
audio.language: Ajahn Chah would invite each junior monk\r\nto give a short Dhamma reflection
audio.category: and this tradition continues to\r\nthis day. On October 27
audio.status: Ajahn Pasanno drew names from the Dhamma hall bell and asked the chosen community member to speak. 0:00 Ajahn Pasanno – Introduction; 3:29 Tan Kaccāna – Repatriated Anthropology; 22:00 Tan Thanāvaro – A Fortunate Time; 31:26 Anagārika Armand – Walking the Walk; 46:04 – Beth Steff – A Dhamma Life (Pārāyanavagga Sn 5); 1:05:23 Debbie Stamp – Space and Ease; 1:18:42 Tan Kasappo – Just Pay Attention to the Body; 1:24:32 Tan Gambhīro – Practicing Like the Krooba Ajahns; 1:26:16 Tan Khantiko – What is Reliable? 1:31:09 Sāmaṇera Kondañño – Pitcher

audio.title: Going Against the Grain
audio.author: Ajahn Jayanto
audio.body: Visiting\r\nfor Kathina from the new Temple Forest Monastery in New Hampshire
audio.language: \r\nAjahn Jayanto reflects on the power of practicing and training as a\r\ncommunity
audio.category: lay and monastic alike. We support each other in the noble\r\neffort of going against the grain of the personal and societal habits\r\nof pursuing desires
audio.mp3:
in order to arrive at a deeper awareness of
where true peace abides.
This
talk was offered on October
31

audio.title: The Monastery: A Place of Transformation
audio.author: Ajahn Viradhammo
audio.body: On\r\nthe occasion of Abhayagiri Kathina 2015
audio.language:
Ajahn Viradhammo rejoices
in the news
that Ajahn Pasanno and Ajahn Amaro have been invited to receive the
title of Chao
Khun
and explains
the meaning and value of mudita (sympathetic joy). He
goes on to reflect on the transformative quality of mudita and uses
several similes to describe the Buddha's path. This
talk was offered on November
1

audio.title: 2015 Abhayagiri Kathina
audio.author: Abhayagiri Sangha
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno leads the Abhayagiri Community in accepting the 2015 Kathina offering and explains the origins of the Kathina ceremony at the time of the Buddha and how Ajahn Chah used this ceremony to promote harmony within and between the lay and monastic communities. Recorded on November 1
audio.language:
2015 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

\r\n

audio.title: Upasika Day: What is Jhāna?
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Beginning\r\nwith the meaning of the word jhāna
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno explains jhāna as a fundamental clarity and stillness that the mind can experience. The Paṇcālacaṇḍana Sutta (SN 2:7) describes it as opening amidst confinement. In response to questions
audio.category: Ajahn Pasanno clarifies the difference between mindfulness\r\nand concentration. This\r\ntalk was offered on the October 10
audio.status: “Jhāna – A\r\nPractical Approach” at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.\r\n

audio.title: Upasika Day: Abandoning the Hindrances
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Freedom from the Five Hindrances is a prerequisite for jhāna. Ajahn Karuṇadhammo emphasizes experiencing the affective nature of a hindrance in the body rather than proliferating about the object of the hindrance in the mind. He presents the canonical similes for the hindrances in terms of water (SN 46.55) and undesirable conditions (MN 39) and leads a guided meditation on abandoning the hindrances. Questions about pain
audio.language: multiple hindrances
audio.category: and\r\nobsessive thinking follow the meditation. This guided meditation was\r\noffered on the October 10
audio.status: “Jhāna – A\r\nPractical Approach” at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.\r\n

audio.title: Upasika Day: Questions and Answers About Jhāna
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Beginning\r\nwith passages about jhāna from the Pali Canon
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno answers a series of salient questions about jhāna. He goes on to read a passage from the Mahasaccaka Sutta (MN 36) in which the Boddhisatta reflects upon his spontaneous experience of jhāna as a child and the canonical similes for the four jhānas (MN 39). Ajahn Pasanno concludes by reading a selection from Ajahn Chah's talk “Detachment Within Activity” as a guided meditation (p. 296 in The Collected Teachings of Ajahn Chah). This question and answer session occurred on the October 10
audio.mp3: “Jhāna – A Practical Approach”\r\nat Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.\r\n

audio.title: Upasika Day: More Questions About Jhāna
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Continuing\r\nfrom the previous recording
audio.language:
Ajahn Pasanno continues to answer
practical questions about the details of jhāna. This
question
and answer session occurred on
the October 10
audio.mp3: “Jhāna – A Practical Approach”\r\nat Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.\r\n

audio.title: The Mysterious Ways of Dhamma
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif">Ajahn Ñaniko begins by reflecting on the mysterious way one gains knowledge of dhamma over time
audio.category: almost without knowing it is happening. Then he shares the\r\nstory of last week\'s difficult delivery of the new Buddha rupa from\r\nThailand
audio.mp3: reflecting that the successful outcome of the day was completely out of the community's control. These two reflections remind us that when we trust in the refuge of the dhamma things seem to fall into place in mysterious ways. This talk was offered on November 7

audio.title: If Samadhi Is Not on the Docket / Following Dukkha Down to the Source
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: What\'s\r\nso wrong with that? In this talk
audio.language:
Ajahn
Karuṇadhammo reflects
on dukkha and the nature of not getting what we want.
He
relates his own experiences contemplating and experiencing dukkha as
a bodily experience as opposed to thinking about or using the
intellect.
What
can be revealed about this kind of exploration is clarity around the
self of self
audio.category: me and mine. This\r\ntalk was offered on November\r\n10

audio.title: Opening Doors
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: After\r\na community work day in which monastic and lay practitioners worked\r\ntogether to rebuild the road to Ajahn Pasanno\'s kuti
audio.language:
Ajahn
Ñaniko contemplates
how
this
kind of offering to one's teachers is a beautiful way to repay them
for the doors they have opened for us on the path. He then offers us
a series of reflections based on what he has gleaned over the years from some of
his teachers. This
talk was offered on November
14

audio.title: Gratitude
audio.author: Contentment
audio.body: gratitude-contentment-and-generosity
audio.category: Drawing on different layers of the Buddha\'s teaching
audio.mp3: Tan Kaccāna weaves together the themes of gratitude
audio.user: and generosity. This talk was offered on November 28

audio.title: Arousing Urgency
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Reflecting on the morning chanting (Abhayagiri Chanting Book p.21)
audio.language: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo encourages us to see clearly the danger in aging
audio.mp3: and instability in order to shake off complacency and make effort to realize the freedom from fear that arises when we no longer take refuge in unreliable conditions. This talk was offered on December 3

audio.title: Seclusion
audio.author: Dispassion
audio.body: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.language: seclusion-dispassion-cessation-relinquishment
audio.status:
” Ajahn Pasanno
recommends investigating the underlying attitudes we bring to
practice. He explains four qualities of heart that the Buddha advises
us to cultivate in conjunction with all factors of the path. This
talk was offered on November
18

audio.title: Reflecting on Beauty and Disappointment
audio.author: Ajahn Viradhammo
audio.body: Pondering the iconography at the Berkeley Buddhist Monastery
audio.language: Ajahn Viradhammo reflects upon the path to the transcendent
audio.category: which begins by making experience fully conscious
audio.status: and observing the arising and cessation of all phenomena. This talk was offered on November 3

audio.title: Skillful Action is Our Protection
audio.author: Tan Kaccāna
audio.body: Reflecting on the connections between the Five Recollections (AN 5.57; Abhayagiri Chanting Book p.39)
audio.language: Subrahma's Problem (SN 2.17)
audio.category: and the Mangala Sutta (Sn 2.4; Chanting Book p. 32)
audio.mp3:
Tan Kaccāna explains the Buddha's teaching that our own skillful
kamma (action) is our refuge. This
talk was offered on November
21

audio.title: Cry Until the Tears Dry Up
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.language: serif">Beginning with a reflection on the aspects of service and gratitude found in living in community
audio.category: Ajahn Ñaniko's thoughts turn to the aspect of endurance in practice. He reflects on the Buddha's encouragement to make an honest assessment of where one is at and proceed from there
audio.mp3: then shares a poignant but illuminating experience from his own practice in Thailand. This talk was offered on December 5

audio.title: 3 Refuges and 8 Precepts
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: The three (3) refuges and eight (8) precepts given at the beginning of Abhayagiri\'s 2013 Thanksgiving Retreat. This was recorded on November 22
audio.language:
2013.

Practice this with Chanting Karaoke.

audio.title: The Pursuit of Happiness
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\"><span style=\"font-weight: normal\">While\r\naccompanying a fellow monastic on a trip to the emergency room
audio.category: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo contemplates the fragility of all that we tend to cling to as stable and controlled by a self. This drives home for him the realization that the concept of a “right to life
audio.status: and the pursuit of happiness” can be just another path to suffering if striven for without right view. This talk was offered on December 12

audio.title: Elemental Practice
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif">Ajahn Ñaniko contemplates the importance of finding forms of dhamma practice that suit ones own temperament. He then shares in some depth a way of practice that has been of benefit to him – working with the six elements: earth
audio.youtube_id: and consciousness. This talk was offered on December 18

audio.title: Patience
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language:
serif"><font style="font-size: 12pt" size="3"><em><span style="font-style: normal"><span style="font-weight: normal">Often
in trying situations with difficult people we might think that
turning our thoughts to loving-kindness may be the antidote to our
frustration. But
audio.category: as Ajahn Karuṇadhammo\r\nreflects
audio.mp3: sometimes the better choice is to turn the mind to khanti – patience. Yet patience does not mean passive endurance
audio.status: for patience has the power to help us penetrate the first noble truth and to affect kamma. This talk was offered on December 19

audio.title: 2015 Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat Entire
audio.author: Abhayagiri Sangha
audio.body: This is a 580 MB zip file of the 27 talks given by Ajahn Pasanno
audio.language: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.mp3: and Debbie Stamp at the 2015 Thanksgiving Monastic Retreat in Santa Rosa
audio.status: California from November 20 to November 29. The zip file contents are available for online browsing (opens in new tab) and can be requested on CD.

audio.title: The End of the Long Road of Suffering
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: Beginning by paying homage to our Thai teachers
audio.language: Ajahn Ñaniko reflects upon what stirs us to go forth as monastics. He goes on to explain how the four protective meditations (death contemplation
audio.mp3: contemplating the unattractive nature of the body
audio.status: and recollection of the Buddha) can provide an underlying sense of well-being on the path. This talk was offered on December 25

audio.title: The Supreme Offering
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body:
\r\n

Contemplating\r\nthe new year
audio.language: Ajahn Ñaniko reflects upon the themes of generosity
audio.category: \r\ncultivating the four factors of Right Effort
audio.mp3: and developing patient\r\nendurance. This talk was offered on December 31

audio.title: Choosing Our Teachers
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: In a sutta from the Aṅguttara Nikāya the Buddha describes four facts one can observe about a person
audio.language:
which
Ajahn
Karuṇadhammo
reflects
can
be qualities one can use in looking for a good teacher.
But
what to do when there is no external teacher present? The Buddha
taught that we carry six excellent teachers within us at all times.
This
talk was offered on January
2

audio.language: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo reflects that having never met the revered founder of our tradition he can only have an impression of the man
audio.category: created from the teachings left behind and the stories he has heard. He shares some of both
audio.mp3: including reading from the published talk “Toward the Unconditioned.” This talk was offered on January 16

audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo

audio.language: serif\">A\r\nquarter of the way through the Winter\r\nRetreat
audio.category: Ajahn Jotipālo offers encouragement to renew expectations and foster determinations made at the start of the retreat. He gives several practical ideas for enlivening one's connection to the body
audio.mp3: including Ajahn Sucitto's instructions on standing meditation. This talk was offered on January 23
audio.status: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.language: serif\">Reflecting\r\non his rec
audio.category: serif\">ent title \"Chao Khun\" bestowed by the king of

audio.status: Ajahn Pasanno contemplates what the Buddha called “the\r\ncalamitous nature of gain
audio.youtube_id: and fame.” While his heart is\r\nfilled with gratitude for these expressions of appreciation

audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: Having been recently reading books that address the unique complexities of modern times and the ability of the human spirit to cope with them
audio.language: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo reflects on what the Buddha\'s teachings have to offer us in dealing with disorientation in a rapidly changing world. This talk was offered on January 31

audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">Encouraging\r\nthe community to experiment with spending more practice time\r\noutdoors
audio.category: Ajahn Jotipālo reflects on several of his experiences practicing in nature. One particular incident taught him the power of metta meditation in the presence of fear
audio.mp3: and this leads him into sharing an alternate perspective on working with metta. This talk was offered on February 15
audio.status: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

At

upon him by

Prince of
Thailand on

audio.language: 2015\r\n(https://www.abhayagiri.org/news/slideshow-of-chao-khun-ceremony)

the newly-dubbed “Phra Bodhinyanavidesa” expresses his gratitude

audio.language: ill will

audio.user: but as tools for wisdom no matter how far along the path one is. This talk was offered on March 1

audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: The difference between pursuing a path of sense pleasure and pursuing the path of Dhamma is an irreconcilable one
audio.language: Ajahn Ñaniko tells us. He then recounts the story of the young bodhisatta\'s encounters with the four heavenly messengers that led him to relinquish the world of comforts and possessions for a homeless life in nature
audio.category: and shares tales and teachings on the wisdom of nature and the nature of wisdom. This talk was offered on March 7

audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">Responding\r\nto comments on his reference to a story about Ajahn Chah in his\r\nprevious talk
audio.category: Ajahn\r\nJotipālo reads the\r\nfull story

audio.status: an encounter between Ajahn Chah and a teacher he had\r\nsought out to aid with difficulties in his meditation

audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif\">Reflecting\r\non sutta MN 13
audio.category: The\r\nGreater Discourse on the Mass of Suffering
audio.mp3: Ajahn Pasanno contemplates how the sense bases and the aggregates have many pleasures to offer us but also many dangers
audio.status: and that ultimately our path is one of escape from both. This talk was offered on March 19
audio.user: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Keeping Nibbana in Mind
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif">Ajahn Ñaniko encourages us to keep nibbana in mind – first with a chance for us to sit and literally imagine being enlightened; then with a teaching on the three aspects of mental cultivation and the seven factors of awakening. This talk was offered on March 22
audio.category: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.language: Thai

audio.title: The Bonds of Fellowship
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif\">As\r\nthe
audio.category: serif\">sangha
audio.mp3: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><span style=\"font-style: normal\"><span style=\"font-weight: normal\">\r\nprepares to reenter world of day-to-day interactions after three\r\nmonths of retreat
audio.user: serif\">Ajahn\r\nJotipālo
audio.youtube_id: serif\">offers\r\na reflection on the Sangaha Sutta – the Buddha\'s teaching on the four grounds of fellowship.

audio.title: A Small Thing
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: <font face=\"Times New Roman
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">After\r\na brief chanting ceremony of mutual requesting of forgiveness
audio.category: Ajahn\r\nPasanno reminds the community that while the Winter Retreat is now ended
audio.mp3: the training continues. But although the practice is of great importance
audio.status: the teachings of the Buddha are not so complicated that we can't realize their rewards. This talk was offered on March 30
audio.user: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: The True Mind Beneath
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">Encouraging\r\nthe community to continue pursuing practice with enthusiasm after\r\nthree months in retreat
audio.category: Ajahn Pasanno reminds us that the true\r\nnature of mind is radiant and peaceful. While the perception may be\r\nthat the moods and objects of mind are what are real and permanent
audio.mp3: the goal of training is to clear away these obstructions to uncover the true mind waiting to be accessed beneath. This talk was offered on April 2
audio.status: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: The Secret of the Pipe Masters
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: Using metaphors of surfing and monastery water maintenance
audio.language: Ajahn Ñaniko reflects on how in practice
audio.mp3: we learn by trial and error until we discover the simple combination of mindfulness and effort. This talk was offered on April 6

audio.title: How Not to Invest in Your Self
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif\">Ajahn\r\nPasanno offers us a\r\nkind of user\'s guide to the self
audio.category: drawing a clear distinction between having a self and investing in your self. This talk was offered on April 9
audio.mp3: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: A Small Fire
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif">Ajahn Jotipālo uses a metaphor of his preferred method for burning a brush pile to reflect on how to approach one's practice from the details rather than the goal. This talk was offered on April 14
audio.category:
2016\r\nat Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

\r\n

audio.title: Practical Faith
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif\">In\r\nBuddhism the word sadha
audio.category: usually translated as “faith” does not refer to an unshakeable belief in something. As Ajahn Pasanno explains
audio.mp3: sadha is a kind of confidence that works hand in hand with effort
audio.youtube_id: and discernment to help us find our own way to what is true. This talk was offered on April 16

audio.title: Daily Life Jhana
audio.author: Ajahn Sucitto
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif">People often have the idea that one practices “concentration” to achieve “special meditative states of mind” called jhana
audio.category: but Ajahn Sucitto points out that in fact jhana is a daily life practice of absorbing into the wholesomeness of nature that leads to the embodiment of samadhi – a unified state of the heart. This talk was offered on April 21
audio.mp3: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Uncovering the Path
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">Asked\r\nthe question
audio.category: “How do I know if I'm progressing on the path?” Ajahn Pasanno reflects that our practice is an act of uncovering a peaceful inclination of mind that already exists. The way to this uncovering
audio.user: “What am I getting from\r\nthis practice?” but instead
audio.youtube_id: “What can I let go of?” This talk was offered on April 23

audio.title: Don\'t Look Past the Ordinary
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">We\r\nare not helpless victims of our unskillful patterns of body
audio.status: Ajahn Pasanno tells us. We may have allowed them\r\nto become an\r\nordinary part of us
audio.user: just as we may have allowed the taking of\r\nrefuges and precepts to become ordinary. But we must find ways to keep\r\nthe refuges and precepts fresh
audio.youtube_id: for they are an active way out of the ordinary causes of our everyday suffering. This talk was offered on April 29

audio.title: A Noble Search
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">What\r\nis it that helps the mind become clear
audio.category: the heart become peaceful? Ajahn Pasanno teaches that it is not the use of speculative thought nor the passive observation of experience. Rather
audio.mp3: the Buddha's approach is to cultivate the capacity of the mind for “mindfulness” – the ardent application of effort to recognize and relinquish the hindrances to our awakening. This talk was offered on April 30
audio.status: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: The Best Investment
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">Recently\r\nreturned from a ten-day tudong with Tan Kassapo
audio.category: Ajahn Ñaniko relates some of their encounters along the way. He reflects on how this form of practice benefits both the wandering monastics and those who offer them nourishment and support. This talk was offered on May 5
audio.mp3: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Dhamma Talk Request
audio.author: Abhayagiri Sangha
audio.body: For many years
audio.language: Iris Landsberg (1949-2014) graced Abhayagiri evening sittings with her beautiful Dhamma talk request. This recording came from Ajahn Amaro\'s October 18

audio.title: Ajahn Passano at DRBU: An Integrated Path
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif">Asked to speak on the interrelationship of three kinds of meditative practice – metta
audio.mp3: and samatha – Ajahn Pasanno emphasizes that the Buddha's path has but one goal – liberation from suffering – and all the tools he offered us work together to this end. This talk was offered on April 11
audio.status: 2016 at Dharma Realm Buddhist University in Ukiah

audio.title: Life in a Rock Tumbler
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif">Inspired by a recent period of group forest practice and the previous week's anagarika ordinations
audio.category: Ajahn\r\nJotipālo offers\r\nreflections on living successfully in a disparate community
audio.mp3: an\r\nenvironment that one of his earliest teachers
audio.status: Gloria Taraniya referred to as “a rock tumbler.” He draws on points of etiquette from Ajahn Sucitto's handbook for new anagarikas (http://www.bodhinyanarama.net.nz/docs/anagarikaOrdination.txt). This talk was offered on May 13
audio.user: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Purifying the Knowing
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">On\r\none level
audio.mp3: \r\nthe Buddha\'s teachings are quite simple –\r\ndo good
audio.user: purify the mind. But there is often a hidden intention in our mental practice – to get rid of unwanted thoughts and feelings. Yet this is wrong view and just another defilement. The Buddha's way to purifying the mind allows us to use thought in a way that leads much deeper. This talk was offered on May 14
audio.youtube_id: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Lies of the Mind
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif">For the Vesakha Puja Ajahn Jotipālo reads a talk by Ajahn Chah
audio.category: inspired\r\nby the story of a\r\nmonk in the Buddha\'s time named Tucho Potthila
audio.mp3: whom the Buddha referred to as “Venerable Empty Scripture.” Ajahn Chah uses this story to help us see that if we nurture only a superficial practice we become victims of the lies of our minds. This talk was offered on May 20
audio.status: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Impermanence Over and Over
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">The\r\nnight after the Vesakha Puja
audio.category: Ajahn Ñaniko reflects on the inspiration of centuries of great beings who kept the Buddha's teachings going through many ups and downs of history. And like them
audio.mp3: our path to liberation is to heed the Buddha's final words: “All things are impermanent – strive on with diligence.” This talk was offered on May 21
audio.status: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.status:
Ajahn Dtun tells the
story of three incidents in his life before ordination when he
encountered and contemplated death and developed saṁvega

and

audio.body: \r\n
audio.language:
serif"><font style="font-size: 12pt" size="3"><em><span style="font-style: normal">In

audio.mp3: \r\nworking with\r\nnegative feelings during meditation

audio.title: Keep Moving Forward
audio.author: Ajahn Ñāniko
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">In\r\nhis farewell talk before leaving for Thailand
audio.category: Ajahn Ñāniko reviews time he has spent at both Abhayagiri and in Thailand. He reflects on the importance and rewards of persistent effort
audio.mp3: solitude and gratitude for others. This talk was offered on June 11
audio.status: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Elements of Not-Self
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: <font face=\"Times New Roman
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">After\r\na period of much busyness at the monastery
audio.category: Ajahn Pasanno contemplates how viewing activities through the lens of the four basic elements can help us approach our lives from the simpler and more peaceful perspective of not-self. This talk was offered on June 12
audio.mp3: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Keeping the Spirit Level
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif">Ajahn Amaro offers reflections on how we can maintain our spiritual values in the midst of political turmoil. This talk was offered on June 8
audio.category: 2016 at Yoga Mendocino in Ukiah

audio.title: Questions and Answers at Yomo: What Would Kipling Do?
audio.author: Ajahn Amaro
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif\">Ajahn\r\nAmaro responds to\r\nquestions about holding opinions
audio.mp3: and information overload. He then discusses how to make good choices based on the Buddha's teaching on the useful qualities of a well-rounded person. This question and answer session was offered on June 8
audio.status: 2016 at Yoga Mendocino in Ukiah

audio.title: The Freedom of Boundaries
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.body: <div style=\"margin-bottom:0in\"><font face=\"Times New Roman
audio.language: serif">Ajahn Karuṇadhammo encourages us to not push away afflictive states of mind that come up in meditation but rather to experience them with patient endurance
audio.category: allowing one to see these habitual tendencies arise and pass away again and again until they gradually lose their control. He speaks of how the monastic form supports this kind of practice
audio.mp3: and how working with sense restraint as a lay person can do the same. This talk was offered on June 18

audio.title: The Kindness of Corpses
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">Returning\r\nfrom solitary forest practice
audio.category: Ajahn Jotipālo shares reflections on three “S”s that came up for him often over the two-week period – silence
audio.status: and sati (mindfulness). Moving from a contemplation on the stillness of the central object in icon art through reflections on ways emotions can bring us unnecessary pain
audio.user: his recollections culminate in the insight that the choices we make now will inform the quality of our hearts when we've aged. This talk was offered on June 19
audio.youtube_id: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Body
audio.author: Heart
audio.body: body-heart-and-mind-embodying-citta
audio.mp3: Ajahn Sucitto lead a retreat at the Padmasambhava Peace Institute near Cazadero
audio.status: CA from April 23 to April 30. The talks from this retreat are available for download on the DhammaSeed.org website.

audio.title: Healing the Cracks
audio.author: Ajahn Sucitto
audio.body: Ajahn Sucitto describes how the process of papañca (objectification
audio.language: see MN 18) transforms initially holistic sense impressions into abstract nouns such as the future
audio.mp3: and me. Without skill and awareness
audio.status: the resulting loss of empathy leads to internal dissociation from our experience and external disconnection from others. Ajahn Sucitto goes on to relate this process to racism
audio.youtube_id: and the massively skewed distribution the world\'s wealth. He concludes by telling a profound experience of connection he had while traveling Tibet. This talk was offered on April 22

audio.title: Sutta Study Upasika Day: The Human Situation
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: After\r\ndescribing the significance and origin of the suttas
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno describes how we can benefit most from encountering the Buddha's teachings and mentions a few key points from the essay “Befriending the Suttas.” He goes on to read and discuss AN 5.48 “Situations
audio.category: ”\r\nwhich describes the inherent difficulties of the human condition.\r\nThis teaching was offered as part 1 of the June 25

audio.title: Sutta Study Upasika Day: Responding to the Human Situation
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: Ajahn\r\nPasanno reads and explains two suttas from the Aṅguttara Nikāya:\r\nAN 7.6 “Treasures
audio.language: ”\r\nwhich describes seven bright qualities to cultivate in light of the\r\nhuman condition
audio.mp3: which describes eight true refuges and five great gifts.\r\nThis\r\nteaching was offered as part 2 of the June 25

audio.title: Parting Blessing

audio.body: Ajahn Dtun offers parting words of gratitude and encouragement to the Abhayagiri monastic and lay community. This blessing was offered on May 29
audio.language: 2016 at Abhayagiri Monastery and was translated by Ajahn\r\nTejapañño.

audio.title: How to Listen
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.language: serif\">Still\r\nresonating with teachings from the afternoon\'s Upasika Day session on\r\nsutta study
audio.category: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on ways of truly listening – both to external dhamma and the inner lessons of the heart. He then offers a teaching on one of the afternoon's topics – the seven treasures of the noble ones (AN 7.6)
audio.mp3: of which listening is one. This talk was offered on June 25
audio.status: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.
audio.user: of which listening is one.

audio.title: A Conflict in Kosambi
audio.author: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\"><span style=\"font-weight: normal\">As\r\nhe prepares to depart the community to spend the vassa at the Forest\r\nHermitage
audio.category: Ajahn Karuṇadhammo reflects on the importance of keeping harmony within a community. He expounds on the Buddha's teaching of the six principles for cordiality
audio.mp3: which includes questions one can ask of one's own character that can reveal the presence of the fruits of stream entry. This talk was offered on June 27

audio.title: Finding the Silence
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif">Ajahn Jotipālo reflects on mindfulness as a process of finding the silence in each present moment. This talk was offered on July 2
audio.category: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: True Independence
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: \r\n
audio.language: serif">On American Independence Day Ajahn Pasanno reflects on the difference between a conventional idea of freedom – to be able to get and to have things – and a fundamental truth of the Buddha's teachings – that liberation comes from the deep understanding that all things are impermanent. This talk was offered on July 4
audio.category: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: Oil and Water
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif">Ajahn Pasanno reflects on samatha and vipassana not so much as types of meditation practices but as factors of mind that can and should be cultivated at all times. He reminds us that the result of meditation is not to perfect a technique but to arrive at a state where one can see the distinction between the objects of mind and true mind itself. This talk was offered on July 9
audio.category: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: A Condition of Nature
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">As\r\nthe community prepares to enter into the vassa
audio.mp3: Ajahn Pasanno reflects on a section of the Buddha's discourse on Mindfulness of Breathing (http://www.accesstoinsight.org/tipitaka/mn/mn.118.than.html). He uses a simile of two types of trees in the monastery's forest to show us how
audio.status: with\r\nthe breath as an anchor
audio.user: we can use our thoughts skillfully as tools of meditation (vitakka and vicara). This talk was offered on July 16
audio.youtube_id: 2016 at Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.

audio.title: A Gift From the Buddha
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body: On the Āsāḷhā Puja night commemorating the Buddha\'s first teaching after enlightenment
audio.language: Luang Por Pasanno urges us to engage this most important teaching on the 4 Noble Truths with a heart of faith and to investigate the experience of the arising and cessation of dukka. This teaching is the essence of how we all can be liberated. It is the Middle Way of practice and training and and the Middle way of view. Luang Por Pasanno suggests we use the experience of dukka to challenge our assumptions about suffering and ask: is craving or ignorance functioning here? He discusses the qualities of heart which can accomplish the cessation of suffering: relinquishment
audio.status: shedding. This talk was offered on July 19

audio.title: Samaṇa Dhammas
audio.author: Ajahn Jotipālo
audio.body: As the vassa and vinaya study begin
audio.language: Ajahn Jotipalo asks
audio.category: \"what is the training of a samaṇa or practitioner?\" He uses the analogy of sewing robes to describe the training: confidence in the teacher\'s instructions

audio.title: Qualities of One Who Is Peaceful
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language:
serif"><font style="font-size: 12pt" size="3"><em><span style="font-style: normal">Ajahn
Pasanno reminds us that the vassa is a time for formal meditation
practice and traditionally a time to develop the qualities of one who
is peaceful. This is done by using two essential tools in meditation:
vitakka vicāra—directed thought and evaluation—and right view.
He encourages us to lift up in the mind either the meditation object
in samatha practice or the subject of investigation in vipassanā
practice. He refers to Sāriputta's list of five things that assist
right view in liberating the heart: silā
audio.user: and vipassanā.
audio.youtube_id: serif\"><span style=\"font-style: normal\">This\r\ntalk was offered on August 3

audio.title: Know
audio.author: and Let Go
audio.language: Ajahn Pasanno explains in more detail Ajahn Chah\'s simple description of the Buddha\'s teaching: \"know
audio.category: and let go.\" The refuges and precepts help lay a foundation for simplifying and relinquishment. Knowing things in their true light allows the mind to let go more easily.  Right view
audio.mp3: both mundane (cause and effect) and transcendent (the Four Noble Truths)
audio.status: is the source of the other Eightfold Path factors. Like a cutting from sugar cane
audio.user: whatever grows from it is sweet

audio.title: Our Birthright of Luminosity
audio.author: Ajahn Pasanno
audio.body:
\r\n

\r\n
audio.language: serif\"><font style=\"font-size: 12pt\" size=\"3\"><em><span style=\"font-style: normal\">When\r\nasked by a BBC interviewer what Buddhism teaches that\'s akin to\r\n“original sin
audio.category: ” the King of Thailand replied that what Buddhism has instead is original purity. Ajahn Pasanno reflects on this idea as being our birthright
audio.mp3:
for our minds are
innately pure and luminous. Yet we overlook or completely forget this
fact by continuing to proliferate over our fundamental habits of
mind. Using the concept of Mara as well as metaphors of the head and
tail of a snake and the fate of a contented chicken
audio.status: Luang Por teaches us instead to lift up the heart to a place outside this limited spectrum of happiness and suffering
audio.user: to see that peace and clarity have been waiting all along. This talk was offered on August 13

2016\r\nat Abhayagiri Buddhist Monastery.
